commit_message:
Update documentation for DNS integration

- Split documentation for external DNS integration into a new document
- Update configs to current standards
- Remove use of old designate client

Change-Id: I7a50ad72e35e2c01f874b872ddeff1aa8bfe3424
Closes-Bug: 1722367
Related-Bug: 1725630
(cherry picked from commit f305559292e6ecfd35740268e69b10cf99089fb2)

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments when deleting groups

Keystone removes role assignments that groups have on projects and
domains when deleting groups. This should apply to system role
assignments, too.

Change-Id: Iebedfcae0b77e350e5359b97fa87894af3f1c8ba
Closes-Bug: 1749267
(cherry picked from commit 5a24b96d951537fb12deb7050eb2e7dd7d40fc81)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 08:08:49.000000000', 'message': "Populate application credential data in token

Without this patch, the token formatter does not have enough data to
construct a token created with an application credential. This means
that if the token cache is disabled or expired, when keystone goes to
create the token it will not find any application credential information
and will not recreate the application_credential_restricted parameter in
the token data. This patch creates a new Payload class for application
credentials so that the application credential ID is properly persisted
in the msgpack'd payload. It also adds more data to the token data
object so that the application credential ID and name as well as its
restricted status is available when the token is queried.

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I322a40404d8287748fe8c3a8d6dc1256d935d84a
Closes-bug: #1750415
(cherry picked from commit 796198f19670e3eb899ca3b1db5d2a21a4127a30)
"}]
commit_message:
Populate application credential data in token

Without this patch, the token formatter does not have enough data to
construct a token created with an application credential. This means
that if the token cache is disabled or expired, when keystone goes to
create the token it will not find any application credential information
and will not recreate the application_credential_restricted parameter in
the token data. This patch creates a new Payload class for application
credentials so that the application credential ID is properly persisted
in the msgpack'd payload. It also adds more data to the token data
object so that the application credential ID and name as well as its
restricted status is available when the token is queried.

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I322a40404d8287748fe8c3a8d6dc1256d935d84a
Closes-bug: #1750415
(cherry picked from commit 796198f19670e3eb899ca3b1db5d2a21a4127a30)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 17:48:43.000000000', 'message': "Check quota before creating volume snapshots

When creating a snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we
create a snapshot of every volume BDM associated with the
instance. The default volume snapshot limit is 10, so if
you have a volume-backed instance with several volumes attached
and snapshot it a few times, you're likely to fail the
volume snapshot at some point with an OverLimit error from
Cinder. This can lead to orphaned volume snapshots in Cinder
that the user then has to cleanup.

This change makes the snapshot operation a bit more robust by
first checking the quota limit and current usage for the given
project before attempting to create any volume snapshots.

It's not fail-safe since we could still fail with racing snapshot
requests for the same project, but it's a simple improvement to
avoid this issue in the general case.

Change-Id: I4e7b46deb43c0c2430b480f1a498a52fc4a9daf0
Related-Bug: #1731986

commit_message:
Check quota before creating volume snapshots

When creating a snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we
create a snapshot of every volume BDM associated with the
instance. The default volume snapshot limit is 10, so if
you have a volume-backed instance with several volumes attached
and snapshot it a few times, you're likely to fail the
volume snapshot at some point with an OverLimit error from
Cinder. This can lead to orphaned volume snapshots in Cinder
that the user then has to cleanup.

This change makes the snapshot operation a bit more robust by
first checking the quota limit and current usage for the given
project before attempting to create any volume snapshots.

It's not fail-safe since we could still fail with racing snapshot
requests for the same project, but it's a simple improvement to
avoid this issue in the general case.

Change-Id: I4e7b46deb43c0c2430b480f1a498a52fc4a9daf0
Related-Bug: #1731986

commit_message:
Fixing v1 Dashboard

- Use openstack_dashboard.api.neutron instead of openstack_dashboard.api.network
- Made action_present and action_past callable.
- Fixed compatibility issues with Django.
- Removed unused import.

Change-Id: Iaa37f1ef90ee3188c7099a0accdf372191f8f509

[{'created': '2018-02-20 14:55:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant test

tests/unit/test_service.py doesn't check anything.
Original class rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was
designed to handle discovering services in case of Neutron/Nova-Network

After nova-net stuff had been removed from novaclient,
rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was removed as well. But
we forgot to remove the test module for it.

Change-Id: I4d0f897b08496f2dca71a0615704bac2f6d70146

Original class rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was
designed to handle discovering services in case of Neutron/Nova-Network

After nova-net stuff had been removed from novaclient,
rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was removed as well. But
we forgot to remove the test module for it.

Change-Id: I4d0f897b08496f2dca71a0615704bac2f6d70146
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant test

tests/unit/test_service.py doesn't check anything.
Original class rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was
designed to handle discovering services in case of Neutron/Nova-Network

After nova-net stuff had been removed from novaclient,
rally.plugin.openstack.UnifiedOpenStackService was removed as well. But
we forgot to remove the test module for it.

Change-Id: I4d0f897b08496f2dca71a0615704bac2f6d70146

used by Ansible.

commit_message:
Remove duplicated call to ansible-playbook.

After merging [0], it seems that an extra
command to run the CI job via ansible-playbook
was left. An error was displayed as the left
command didn't include the playbook to run.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525765/9

Change-Id: Ibb9eb78c8e4ef72da820ac64f755176356f9ab3c
Closes-Bug: #1750518

subject: Add mask_password to sanitize sensitive data
messages:
[{'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2017-10-17 07:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-10-18 13:58:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This is going to be a lot to maintain, did you see Jamie's alternative proposal? http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123024.html"}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2017-10-27 09:55:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Colleen Murphy,

The password is getting leaked from the response of the main RESTful API request and not from the auth request.

For example: The 'nova evacuate' API if called with api_version 2.9 then it returns the 'adminPass' in the response body.

The auth request [1] takes the 'log=False' which results into not logging the auth request response.

If we do the same(solution suggested by Jamie [2]) with the actual API request(pass log=False [3]) then the response will never to logged for every RESTful API request.
However we should only mask/hide the response of API calls which contains sensitive data.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/base.py#L163-L165
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123024.html
[3] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/session.py#L682-L698"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-01-19 16:20:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This is a ton to maintain as Colleen said. I am not comfortable with Keystoneauth needing to be aware of every single field to sanitize. We should have a mechanism where a logger that santitizes can be passed and then it is on the consumer to sanitize the log by passing a smart logger/call back to the system.

Marking this with a -2 because this is the wrong approach. I'll walk back the -2 to a -1 if we move to where a callback/logger can be passed that does the sanitization."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:37:56.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Administratively abandoning this. We're not moving forward with this direction."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 07:20:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add mask_password to sanitize sensitive data

The debug logs are displaying unsanitized user data and could
result in people unintentionally sharing secrets. The method
"_http_log_response" logs data without masking.

There were four solutions discussed to solve this issue on
bug-1638978 and on ML thread [1]. The last 3 solutions have
dependency on oslo.utils which is not acceptable as discussed
on bug comment [2].

This patch implements solution 1)
Carry a copy of mask_password() method to keystoneauth from oslo_utils.

NOTE:
* This patch also copies all the related code to mask_password() method
  from oslo_utils. For ex., "_SANITIZE_KEYS".
* keystoneauth will have to keep the version of mask_password() method
  sync with oslo_utils version. If there are any new "_SANITIZE_KEYS"
  added to oslo_utils mask_password then those should be added in
  keystoneauth mask_password also.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122725.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystoneauth/+bug/1700751/comments/3

Closes-Bug: #1638978
Change-Id: I5e926eef0057874e0363e9064dbf4bc2d28f63b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add mask_password to sanitize sensitive data

The debug logs are displaying unsanitized user data and could
result in people unintentionally sharing secrets. The method
"_http_log_response" logs data without masking.

There were four solutions discussed to solve this issue on
bug-1638978 and on ML thread [1]. The last 3 solutions have
dependency on oslo.utils which is not acceptable as discussed
on bug comment [2].

This patch implements solution 1)
Carry a copy of mask_password() method to keystoneauth from oslo_utils.

NOTE:
* This patch also copies all the related code to mask_password() method
  from oslo_utils. For ex., "_SANITIZE_KEYS".
* keystoneauth will have to keep the version of mask_password() method
  sync with oslo_utils version. If there are any new "_SANITIZE_KEYS"
  added to oslo_utils mask_password then those should be added in
  keystoneauth mask_password also.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122725.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystoneauth/+bug/1700751/comments/3

Closes-Bug: #1638978

'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 09:51:32.000000000', 'message': 's390x fc: Fix device path for Ubuntu with ds8k

The device path to a block device on Ubuntu using a ds8k LUN

Change-Id: I92f1e5a2c7203af6c01c4742067ced16a840eb04
'}]
commit_message:
s390x fc: Fix device path for Ubuntu with ds8k

The device path to a block device on Ubuntu using a ds8k LUN
differs from the device path for other storage systems.

This patch adds the new device path as third possibility.

Change-Id: I92f1e5a2c7203af6c01c4742067ced16a840eb04

Sorry, rethinking this patch again over the weekend.. I think the addition of the new rescue interface is incorrect. You're not introducing a new rescue interface, you're assuming that rescue is going to be used with the virtual media boot interface. All the new code belongs to the boot interface, and I suggest leaving it there.

I think we're in the same situation as with the network interface here (and I somewhat regret even havign a separate rescue interface now): an optional functionality from the boot interface is exposed by through the rescue interface. Maybe we should have BootInterface.validate_rescue similar to one in the network interface? And also BootInterface.get_rescue_properties? Then your whole new rescue interface implementation is simply not needed. Bonus point for potential mergeability of it during the feature freeze, as what you have here is clearly a feature.

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

I'm afraid my previous review was not enough. boot_iso is removed at the head of rescuing[1][2]. However, ilo_boot_iso is not removed from instance_info. I guess this causes an error here[3][4][5] at unrescue. So, it seems necessary to remove ilo_boot_iso from instance_info as the previous revision or soon after boot_iso is removed. Otherwise, it might be better to skip removing boot_iso for reusing at unrescue.

commit_message:
Implements validate_rescue() for IloVirtualMediaBoot

This commit implements validate_rescue() for 'ilo-virtual-media'
boot interface of 'ilo' hardware type.

With this it enables 'agent' rescue interface for 'ilo' hardware
type when corresponding boot interface being used is
'ilo-virtual-media'. Support already exists for the 'agent'
rescue interface with 'ilo-pxe' boot interface.

Co-Authored-By: Aparna <aparnavtce@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1674899
Change-Id: Ia1d879e1356de18c5f14f032ddd195f4b48f0378

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/00/509500/1/check/gate-project-config-layout/9e18b87/ : SUCCESS in 8m 41s'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-10-04 15:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-04 15:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please make the same change to zuul.d/projects.yaml - then we could merge this.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-29 14:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have switched to Zuul v3 now, this change does not apply anymore.

Learn on how to update your change with Zuul v3 at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html .

Simplified:
* Job definitions can be in-repo; common job definitions are in
  openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repository
* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,
  common jobs are configured via
  openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-20 15:56:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-04 15:09:00.000000000', 'message': "Move tempest-dsvm-ceph-nv jobs to experimental queue

This moves the ceph dsvm tempest non-voting jobs from
the check to experimental queue for:

  - cinder
  - nova
  - glance
  - tempest
  - os-brick
  - glance_store

The job has been non-voting since January 2017:

  I34406a4d5e09d4d6d712764c278cecc159e596e3

There was talk at the Pike PTG in February 2017 about
whitelisting what was run in the test so we could decrease
the concurrency of the tests that are run in the hopes of
increasing the stability, but the person that was going
to work on that is no longer involved and the job is basically
not maintained.

Also, looking at graphite data over the last 3 months it's
nearly 100% fail so at this point running it in check even
though it's non-voting is just wasting time and resources
until someone cares about fixing this job.

Change-Id: Idff04a43112d08a98769162fccfeb3f8471d272e
"}]
commit_message:
Move tempest-dsvm-ceph-nv jobs to experimental queue

This moves the ceph dsvm tempest non-voting jobs from
the check to experimental queue for:

  - cinder
  - nova
  - glance
  - tempest
  - os-brick
  - glance_store

The job has been non-voting since January 2017:

  I34406a4d5e09d4d6d712764c278cecc159e596e3

There was talk at the Pike PTG in February 2017 about
whitelisting what was run in the test so we could decrease
the concurrency of the tests that are run in the hopes of
increasing the stability, but the person that was going
to work on that is no longer involved and the job is basically
not maintained.

Also, looking at graphite data over the last 3 months it's
nearly 100% fail so at this point running it in check even
though it's non-voting is just wasting time and resources
until someone cares about fixing this job.

[{'created': '2018-02-08 09:07:32.000000000', 'message': "Remove too large configdrive for handling error

When configdrive is too large, a node object cannot be saved to DB. If
it happens, the node cannot moved to DEPLOYFAIL because saving the node
is prevented again by the large configdrive in the object. In this
case, the node gets stuck in DEPLOYING, which doesn't allow any state
transition.

This patch removes the configdrive from a node object when storing the
configdrive fails. This also catches any unexpected exception from
_store_configdrive() to avoid getting a node stuck in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I83cf3e02622fc3ed8f5b5389f533e374c1b985f3
Closes-Bug: 1745630

commit_message:
Remove too large configdrive for handling error

When configdrive is too large, a node object cannot be saved to DB. If
it happens, the node cannot moved to DEPLOYFAIL because saving the node
is prevented again by the large configdrive in the object. In this
case, the node gets stuck in DEPLOYING, which doesn't allow any state
transition.

This patch removes the configdrive from a node object when storing the
configdrive fails. This also catches ConfigInvalid exception, which is
mentioned in the docsting, and any unexpected exception from
_store_configdrive() to avoid getting a node stuck in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I83cf3e02622fc3ed8f5b5389f533e374c1b985f3
Closes-Bug: 1745630

commit_message:
Make ext subnet config optional

It is common for Neutron deployment's policy to forbid GETs to the
public subnet, only allowing GETs for the public net. Since the only
required field of those two for creating a FIP is the public net, let's
change public net to be the only required config option and have the
subnet stick around as optional.

Change-Id: I31c3c51ad2dc12f8f560cbab01c86d04aabb754e
Closes-Bug: 1749921
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Remove note about eucatools

Nova does not provide an ec2 api - the ec2 api project does. There is no
need for a mention of eucatools here - OpenStack documentation should
refrain from treating ec2 compat layer as a general 'alternate'
mechanism. The docs for the ec2api project can explain how to use it,
and the ec2 docs can explain how to use eucatools.

Change-Id: Icaadb43079a972ddf2640a725a0ea6f02ee40be3

commit_message:
federation api: api endpoints

this commit introduces a new '/federations'
endpoint to Magnum API, as well as its controllers,
entities and conductor handlers.

this corresponds to the first phase of the
federation-api spec. please refer to [1] for more
details.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/489609/

Change-Id: I662ac2d6ddec07b50712109541486fd26c5d21de
Partially-Implements: blueprint federation-api
(cherry picked from commit ec950be894e07077012518ff996c48a6e91cdb35)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 19:16:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix misplaced_objects method and align with cleave method

The cleave() and misplaced_objects() both move objects between
brokers, so try to make them as similar as possible:

- use a common object iterator to get objects from source shard ranges
- represent queries using ShardRange's rather than dicts

Also, in misplaced_object():

- make some inline functions first class for clarity and dedent
- don't replicate a shard broker until all objects have been merged to it
- fix a couple of bugs when container listing limit was less than or equal
  to the number of misplaced objects in a shard range
  (before, if objects destined for the same shard range spanned two calls
  to get_objects then the remaining source object(s) in that shard range
  would be deleted before recursing to get_objects again!)
- check that misplaced objects really are misplaced before moving
- log aggregated warning about misplaced objects that could not be
  moved rather than one warning per object

Change-Id: I8013ae801f46ace6679c5dd7fc382a9b66c7d597

commit_message:
Fix misplaced_objects method and align with cleave method

The cleave() and misplaced_objects() both move objects between
brokers, so try to make them as similar as possible:

- use a common object iterator to get objects from source shard ranges
- represent queries using ShardRange's rather than dicts

Also, in misplaced_object():

- make some inline functions first class for clarity and dedent
- don't replicate a shard broker until all objects have been merged to it
- fix a couple of bugs when container listing limit was less than or equal
  to the number of misplaced objects in a shard range
  (before, if objects destined for the same shard range spanned two calls
  to get_objects then the remaining source object(s) in that shard range
  would be deleted before recursing to get_objects again!)
- check that misplaced objects really are misplaced before moving
- log aggregated warning about misplaced objects that could not be
  moved rather than one warning per object

Change-Id: I8013ae801f46ace6679c5dd7fc382a9b66c7d597

[{'created': '2018-02-20 04:26:59.000000000', 'message': 'Return a proper boolean True instead of a 'True' string

The type here is important, returning anything other than a boolean
has unintended consequences such as breaking Ansible callbacks because
they are expecting the "changed" field to be nothing other than a bool
by contract.

Change-Id: Ia9b4a749f64adae8969fd9ad66304d013013e056
'}]
commit_message:
Return a proper boolean True instead of a 'True' string

The type here is important, returning anything other than a boolean
has unintended consequences such as breaking Ansible callbacks because
they are expecting the "changed" field to be nothing other than a bool
by contract.

Change-Id: Ia9b4a749f64adae8969fd9ad66304d013013e056

commit_message:
Get number of hosts from array and iterate over them

Instead of getting hosts from stack resource this patch gets hosts of role from
array and iterate over them at the last step.

Change-Id: I6adcd2be5a3c23ba7661bacc7242190f26e136ad

commit_message:
Configure gate jobs to collect the correct logs

   * collect the correct freezer-api logs
   * collect freezer-agent logs
   * Added Gate hook to collect the logs

Depends-On: I81e417155da48f46dd2113e5745fb3c21c96499f

'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 12:14:06.000000000', 'message': "Part 1: Implement Sqlalchemy driver for freezer-api

Add support to oslo.db to be used as a DB driver. The DB driver will be
used with API v2. When it's completely implemented, API V1 will be 
deprecated and removed by the end of the cycle. Freezer-api will keep 
supporting V2 with Elasticsearch, Sqlalchemy drivers.

This patch implements the follow:
    * Abstract Base DB driver to be implemented by each driver
    * Base driver; will return only access to the db engine, session 
    * SqlAlchemy driver; 
    * ElasticSearch driver;
    * Implement both drivers in freezer-manage 


Partially-Implements: blueprint oslo-db

Depends-On: Idb4ac050652d1d0107bf3fcd447d7cbedd811809
Change-Id: I93ed1b909f538728a1a9bd5c8b07baf7aeddb705

commit_message:
Part 1: Implement Sqlalchemy driver for freezer-api

Add support to oslo.db to be used as a DB driver. The DB driver will be
used with API v2. When it's completely implemented, API V1 will be
deprecated and removed by the end of the cycle. Freezer-api will keep
supporting V2 with Elasticsearch, Sqlalchemy drivers.

This patch implements the follow:
    * Abstract Base DB driver to be implemented by each driver
    * Base driver; will return only access to the db engine, session
    * SqlAlchemy driver;
    * ElasticSearch driver;
    * Implement both drivers in freezer-manage

Partially-Implements: blueprint oslo-db

Depends-On: I81e417155da48f46dd2113e5745fb3c21c96499f
Depends-On: I2e5724b1f1a75121952e2beb3844d2c489e4df68
Depends-On: Idb4ac050652d1d0107bf3fcd447d7cbedd811809
Depends-On: I81d46c89859752c0cbc21ef02de90db7f19f942c
Change-Id: I93ed1b909f538728a1a9bd5c8b07baf7aeddb705

commit_message:
Use package_state=present for CentOS 7 testing

CentOS 7 gates timeout more often due to the use of
package_state=latest (the default). This patch allows tests to run
with package_state=present.

This should speed up gate jobs for CentOS 7 and expose more problems
that can be fixed.

Depends-On: Iae2816c4d623e0f95d07871472727f77df3b4ded
Depends-On: Ib332213b18e04487bd7f330a7fc6fdab1fff7d05
Depends-On: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
Depends-On: Id340ac48a551081031b14804d376e6e5d744fa0d
Change-Id: I229b0691472a12b4d99d6d772f400b758ee1d9bb

subject: Wrong number of nodes: Messaging service in High Availability Guide
messages:
[{'account_id': 27855, 'date': '2018-02-19 04:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-19 04:59:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-19 07:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Update a code-convention to use OpenStackClient as the example. Also

commit_message:
Provide guidance about preferring openstackclient for CLI

Update a code-convention to use OpenStackClient as the example. Also
update the ui-terminology doc to add a note about using OpenStackClient
and not per-project CLI tools.

Change-Id: I167c82f9aa2cc6140d68e61d47af4c0230fb33a6

subject: tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-20 13:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 10:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level a bit and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: I5fc08aedcee05f01d93af787a2672ee38cdcc40a
(cherry picked from commit a7bf973cd5aff042619ad8295a55b7b8cb10ddb7)
'}]
commit_message:
tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level a bit and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: I5fc08aedcee05f01d93af787a2672ee38cdcc40a
(cherry picked from commit a7bf973cd5aff042619ad8295a55b7b8cb10ddb7)

commit_message:
Fix index.rst in order to fix doc building

* The name of the doc was contributing.rst not contribute.rst which
  leads to failure of doc build process during rpm packaging in RDO.
  It fixes the same.

Change-Id: I2a90bf6946e1e6dfd26f087210bf20d87f30e0b5

subject: Set SELinux to permissive mode for tests
messages: [{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAdded this to the CentOS 7 basekit tests patch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 14:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'Set SELinux to permissive mode for tests

The SELinux policy work for CentOS 7 is not yet done, and it is a
tricky process. The gate jobs ran with Permissive mode a couple of
months ago and gate jobs were more stable.

This patch changes the SELinux mode to Permissive for testing.

Change-Id: Ia8fafe5a553fbe8000740984016b42b4ee5b378a
'}]
commit_message:
Set SELinux to permissive mode for tests

The SELinux policy work for CentOS 7 is not yet done, and it is a
tricky process. The gate jobs ran with Permissive mode a couple of
months ago and gate jobs were more stable.

This patch changes the SELinux mode to Permissive for testing.

Change-Id: Ia8fafe5a553fbe8000740984016b42b4ee5b378a

this is for release after mitaka

Is it used for only release after mitaka?

if so, it would be better way to fix this.

Please give me your opinion

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, create a new template in the templates/mitaka directory and it will be used for mitaka and all releases after mitaka.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:14:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Could you please check again?'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sorry, I maybe missing something here. I was expecting to seethe following in the file:

[filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi]
paste.filter_factory = oslo_middleware:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This one seemed to do fine with checks on jan 19: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535748/'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:16:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Can you take a look at a what else has changed in your mitaka template vs what used to be used? commit_message:
Fix rare HTTP 400 from port list API

This may happen when a node is deleted in parallel with calling
the port list API. Ports are fetched, then we try do fetch their
nodes and port groups. If either of them are removed in the meantime,
the API fails with HTTP 400. This change works around it.

Change-Id: Ie2d4c46c031ee86976abb6107433cdde87a4345a
Closes-Bug: #1748893

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Zuulv3-native multinode gate

This commit adds a new, Zuulv3 native multinode gate. It'll be also used
as a base job for all the multinode gates on.

Change-Id: I4cef6421f569b253eab583f38fc86004cead382a

commit_message:
Expand on mv 3.50 description

The 3.50 microversion was added just to have a programmatic
way of determining if the service supports multiattach. The
text for 3.50 was very brief, so it wasn't really clear
what this meant. Expanding on the wording a little to try
to make it a little more clear.

Change-Id: I9b731f8cb68e9339fd5a2831b76cb57a496b6908

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.9

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Ie1d8d8bfaf7ba38b3d5435f6cb98ef57d7a5d35e
Change-Id: I495dec477e2ea8d4c3509a9b0f01c11fa1b74cf4

commit_message:
Support use of json for relation data

In order to provide consistent presentation of relation data
in Python 3 based charms, support passing of data using JSON
format which ensures that data on relations won't continually
change due to non-deterministic dictionary iteration in py3.

Change-Id: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6
Closes-Bug: 1741304
(cherry picked from commit 22d30c2294cffdb5c21361a1c6d102f916b0d205)

commit_message:
Use Drizzle JDBC for monasca-thresh in devstack

MySQL Connector is released under GPLv2 license which restricts the
distribution of the consuming project [1]. This change configures
monasca-thresh to use Drizzle JDBC (BSD license) in devstack.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/licensing.html

Story: 2001522
Task: 6323
Change-Id: I1154e166e1aa6fe6693bdd169d2e5544719fbe6c

commit_message:
Use realpath filter instead of the stat/dir dance

We can make the deployment more efficient if we use the realpath
filter, instead of first checking for the directory and then
implementing the changes in a follow-up task.

This is more readable, simpler and faster to execute.

Change-Id: I6cfe8f0ef8fb1b3ebd8e68bf3bdd0aaf4b96e523

commit_message:
Add assert_mock_multiple_calls_with_same_arguments test helper

During the migration from mox to mock, it turns out there is case where
some method is called multiple times with same parameters and
it is common in openstack dashboard tests.

This commit adds assert_mock_multiple_calls_with_same_arguments assertion
method to ensure to check both call_count and arguments of all calls.

Note that assert_has_calls just checks a subset of called arguments
so it is better to check arguments of all calls.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: Id939e61718b0405a02a22a5ec8e55eda9554c545

commit_message:
Make create_mocks compatible with create_stubs

create_mocks was introduced to mock multiple methods easily,
but its arguments are not compatible with create_stubs for mox.
This requires us to make many many small changes when converting
mox tests into mock. It would be nice if create_mocks is compatible
with create_stubs.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I3d98448b1b9c517c194d692d6b3b53dc00e46223

[{'created': '2018-02-20 12:33:07.000000000', 'message': 'Use all references to keep sphinx >=1.6.1 happy

This changes adds short sections in past specifications to
refer to all references.

Why ?

The main motivation is that our docs jobs currently fails:
we have warning-is-error =1 and recent Spinx have a warning on
unused references, and despite the fact that requirements.txt
mandates sphinx <1.6.1, for some reason this is not honored in
CI jobs.

The second reason is that it seems to makes sense to try to support
recent sphinx releases.

Change-Id: I3b0218013215cd842df1644478c9b03bd761f823
Related-Bug: 1750546
'}]
commit_message:
Use all references to keep sphinx >=1.6.1 happy

This changes adds short sections in past specifications to
refer to all references.

Why ?

The main motivation is that our docs jobs currently fails:
we have warning-is-error =1 and recent Spinx have a warning on
unused references, and despite the fact that requirements.txt
mandates sphinx <1.6.1, for some reason this is not honored in
CI jobs.

The second reason is that it seems to makes sense to try to support
recent sphinx releases.

Change-Id: I3b0218013215cd842df1644478c9b03bd761f823
Related-Bug: 1750546

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic0c60736697631ed45e8105982660cb612064f52

messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-18 15:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-19 08:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am fine with the change, but it doesn't state why we do this in 100%.

This var was used to also not install things for memcached_server, IIRC.
So if we are okay to install pip everywhere, we are good here.

But it should be at least documented."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-20 10:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Now that's documented in the review, we can go ahead."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-18 15:29:46.000000000', 'message': "Replace host_need_pip with standard override mechanism

The variable host_need_pip is currently used to be selective
about when pip is installed on the target hosts/containers.

This is an unnecessary precaution given that if the repo
container is not yet up, there is already a mechanism in place
to detect this and override the constraint and get-pip script
URL. By using this mechanism we get pip installed very early
and pip's configuration is still correctly constrained.

This patch ensures that this very same mechanism is used across
the board instead of using two different mechanisms, thereby
simplifying the approach.

Change-Id: I22d2f5edf640b71cb80b3fd1de597ea7391db11c
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Replace host_need_pip with standard override mechanism

The variable host_need_pip is currently used to be selective
about when pip is installed on the target hosts/containers.

This is an unnecessary precaution given that if the repo
container is not yet up, there is already a mechanism in place
to detect this and override the constraint and get-pip script
URL. By using this mechanism we get pip installed very early
and pip's configuration is still correctly constrained.

This patch ensures that this very same mechanism is used across
the board instead of using two different mechanisms, thereby
simplifying the approach.

Change-Id: I22d2f5edf640b71cb80b3fd1de597ea7391db11c
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
queens: disable tripleo jobs for now

This patch will be reverted once TripleO CI will be ready for
stable/queens, but it's not the case now.

Change-Id: Id847994e932e41095d0eaaba60a0557b2ed15079
(cherry picked from commit 67816dfbebd1e4a39d26b57d2ab053efee36188c)

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Id17185fe699925d849a51a8e2482ef50c93aa229
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Hey Brent, thanks for this. It didn't work for me but I might be missing something:

I missed the --privileged. Now it works!
The namespace can be accessed from inside and outside the container:

$ sudo docker run --name test_netns -td --privileged --net host -v /run/netns:/run/netns:shared centos:7

[heat-admin@overcloud-novacompute-0 ~]$ sudo docker exec -u root -ti c1603a52dd1246645d4fd07bf588ee11a043c7f2c744d2721089fc92a48a3f09 /bin/bash

[root@overcloud-novacompute-0 /]# ip netns add my_netns
[root@overcloud-novacompute-0 /]# exit

[heat-admin@overcloud-novacompute-0 ~]$ ip netns 
my_netns
[heat-admin@overcloud-novacompute-0 ~]$ sudo ip netns e my_netns ip a                                                                                                                         
1: lo: <LOOPBACK> mtu 65536 qdisc noop state DOWN qlen 1
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00

[heat-admin@overcloud-novacompute-0 ~]$ sudo docker restart c1603a52dd12
c1603a52dd12
[heat-admin@overcloud-novacompute-0 ~]$ sudo docker exec -u root -ti c1603a52dd1246645d4fd07bf588ee11a043c7f2c744d2721089fc92a48a3f09 ip netns e my_netns ip a

commit_message:
Mount netns as shared to persist namespaces

Dataplane is breaking when containers are killed. Keeping the namespaces
around allows the network objects (ports, bridges) etc. to remain
intact without the containers running.

Closes-Bug: #1748658
Change-Id: I092500e9ec0820347ba0f865f3c24f828980af3a

commit_message:
Only enforce multiattach policy for retype target

We should only be checking multiattach policy if the target
of a retype is multiattach capable. If they are already on
a type and policy has changed, we should not block retyping.

Change-Id: Id4cfb7771439940c59b828ea7f1d95bcfe7d1e26

commit_message:
bgpvpn: take admin_state_up into account

When admin_state_up is set to False on a port, we need to
stop advertising the corresponding BGPVPN routes.

Change-Id: Idd17d5ef7edc7b1705c0ed25a7cefcd095a1f855
Closes-Bug: 1719597

commit_message:
use vlantransparent api def from neutron-lib

The vlantransparent extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with commit I78c3e0c0b74dd154b6133963dfc8b65f9527bd2c
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code from neutron-lib
and using neutron-lib's implementation.

In addition this patch makes the disable_extension_by_config private.
No consumers are using it today and if necessary they can implement
it in their own project to propose a shared version to lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ibfaa1ebf24caec62f5743975b206400fcd30436d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 13:13:52.000000000', 'message': "Configure instance_discovery_method to naive

To ensure that metering metadata is collected by ceilometer for
storage in gnocchi, use the naive discovery method so that
any appropriate metadata is retrieved from the Nova API by the
ceilometer compute agent prior to dispatch of metric measurements
to gnocchi.

This allows measures to be queired by 'server_group' allowing
assessment of measures for groups of servers (as used in Heat
autoscaling group configurations).

Change-Id: I6a3c09da0a278660943865838d604595b1611481
Closes-Bug: 1749954
"}]
commit_message:
Configure instance_discovery_method to naive

To ensure that metering metadata is collected by ceilometer for
storage in gnocchi, use the naive discovery method so that
any appropriate metadata is retrieved from the Nova API by the
ceilometer compute agent prior to dispatch of metric measurements
to gnocchi.

This allows measures to be queired by 'server_group' allowing
assessment of measures for groups of servers (as used in Heat
autoscaling group configurations).

Change-Id: I6a3c09da0a278660943865838d604595b1611481
Closes-Bug: 1749954

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 12:30:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update YAQL queries with groupBy

YAQL introduced a backward incompatible change in one of its minor
versions:
https://github.com/openstack/yaql/commit/3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025#diff-f36776b660e5fe4f88e3295e5b751396R215

It changes the expected behavior of groupBy() aggregator, so we need to
update our queries otherwise it fails with a "list index out of range"
error.

Change-Id: I2ca2ebb2c8d22aeedbcb6920072db5b6dba3311b
Closes-Bug: #1750032
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e897da3b690dd69883483d818e957fca85721622)
'}]
commit_message:
Update YAQL queries with groupBy

YAQL introduced a backward incompatible change in one of its minor
versions:
https://github.com/openstack/yaql/commit/3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025#diff-f36776b660e5fe4f88e3295e5b751396R215

It changes the expected behavior of groupBy() aggregator, so we need to
update our queries otherwise it fails with a "list index out of range"
error.

Change-Id: I2ca2ebb2c8d22aeedbcb6920072db5b6dba3311b
Closes-Bug: #1750032
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e897da3b690dd69883483d818e957fca85721622)

commit_message:
Set ovb_repo_version to commit which provides --driver

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545042 used
--driver option to build nodes but that's not available
in currently set ovb_repo_version. Update pin for
ovb_repo_version to use the commit which adds support for
--driver option.

Change-Id: I2006022a1b38dc9dc2611522911d1b9910c6f9fa

commit_message:
Update help text for encryption provider

The volume encryption provider no longer uses class names.
Instead, 'luks' and 'plain' are used. This patch updates
the help text for the volume encryption provider to use
the new encryption provider format constants.

Change-Id: I6072e18f8c1945082f421a3bf725a874565d6f80

[{'created': '2018-02-20 03:54:31.000000000', 'message': 'Build instance PXE options for unrescue

This patch always builds PXE options for booting a user image even if
the provision state is related to rescue mode. When the state is
unrescuing, these options are necessary to boot a user image. When the
provision state is rescuing, these options are just ignored because
the PXE configuration is used at deployment mode.

Change-Id: I1ff51cab120e6612c71e5d9c45cf28797bc16e76
Closes-Bug: 1749433
(cherry picked from commit 4df93fc4746184f42e852fbb372c0662aa829a55)
'}]
commit_message:
Build instance PXE options for unrescue

This patch always builds PXE options for booting a user image even if
the provision state is related to rescue mode. When the state is
unrescuing, these options are necessary to boot a user image. When the
provision state is rescuing, these options are just ignored because
the PXE configuration is used at deployment mode.

Change-Id: I1ff51cab120e6612c71e5d9c45cf28797bc16e76
Closes-Bug: 1749433
(cherry picked from commit 4df93fc4746184f42e852fbb372c0662aa829a55)

subject: Disable pubsub when getting nb_api in external apps
messages: [{'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-02-20 06:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23235, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 15:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Disable pubsub when getting nb_api in external apps

The pubsub creates different problems, and every external app
specifically disables it before getting the nb_api instance.
We should hide this behaviour inside the get_instance method.
Also, I called the argument is_external_app as in the future we may want
to add more behavioural differences between the cases.

Change-Id: I25a55737351f8fe14bddafa7c78e60fe096db43e
'}]
commit_message:
Disable pubsub when getting nb_api in external apps

The pubsub creates different problems, and every external app
specifically disables it before getting the nb_api instance.
We should hide this behaviour inside the get_instance method.
Also, I called the argument is_external_app as in the future we may want
to add more behavioural differences between the cases.

Change-Id: I25a55737351f8fe14bddafa7c78e60fe096db43e

commit_message:
Temporarily disable tempest tests

Tempest tests fail randomly at several checks. This failures will be
fixed in the next changes. First we need to to update the location of
Storm download source as this blocks all other fixes.

Let's merge https://review.openstack.org/545832 and revert this change.

Change-Id: I6553eff697339faf12d61e27381515695229ffac

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I5f1fbfb592ecd07ad12708a672cf401d4d481ab3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level a bit and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: I5fc08aedcee05f01d93af787a2672ee38cdcc40a

commit_message:
Add SELinux contexts for nova log directory

The log directory for nova has the default_t SELinux context and this
prevents rsyslog from accessing nova's logs. This patch ensures that
the file contexts are set properly for nova's logs.

This change also makes nova's log directory configurable using the
`nova_log_dir` variable.

Closes-Bug: 1748911
Change-Id: Iaac69c5807715f50386624602375c89adeeb48a1

commit_message:
Centralize setting default branch for stable branching

One of the steps when we create a new stable branch is to
branch devstack, then update the default branch for most
repos to use the new stable branch for each repo.

This requires making multiple updates throughout stackrc,
and to further complicate things, there are some repo
branch variables for branchless repos that should not be
updated along with the others.

This can be error prone if not fully aware of these
exceptions. To simplify this process a little, this
patch adds two common variables - one that can be set to
the new stable branch name for all of the repos that
should be branched, and one that can be used for all of
the branchless repos to make it explicit that those
values should be left alone. The cycle-trailing repos
have until two weeks after final release to branch, so
also adding another variable for those to make it easy
to update them at a later time, separately from the
other repos.

Change-Id: I82aa19e739eeda3721bac1cb5153ad0bf2d1125a

 > probably right:

 > http://logs.openstack.org/60/513160/7/check/nova-next/928d0dd/logs/local.conf.txt.gz

The log line I linked [1] to in my inline comment earlier showed that the service wasn't enabled. When is_service_enabled tls-proxy returns 1, that means the service is not enabled. It's counterintuitive IMHO because it treats it like a status code, 0 means "yes".

'}, {'created': '2018-02-06 22:34:43.000000000', 'message': "Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

The tls-proxy service has been enabled in devstack-gate
by default since Ocata, see change:

Ic21c0213c8ea91f3d7c30f03227af7b5a107b527

So we don't have to enable that service explicitly here,
we just need to set NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS flag
in devstack.

Depends-on: Ib29d3f5f18533115b9c51e27b373e92fc0a28d1a

Change-Id: I203163b09613734b3e792bee7e5a931f0888378e
"}, {'created': '2018-02-07 18:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

by default since Ocata, see change:

So we don't have to enable that service explicitly here,
we just need to set NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS flag
in devstack.

Depends-on: Ib29d3f5f18533115b9c51e27b373e92fc0a28d1a

Change-Id: I203163b09613734b3e792bee7e5a931f0888378e
"}, {'created': '2018-02-12 17:06:02.000000000', 'message': "Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

The tls-proxy service has been enabled in devstack-gate
by default since Ocata, see change:

Ic21c0213c8ea91f3d7c30f03227af7b5a107b527

So we don't have to enable that service explicitly here,
we just need to set NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS flag
in devstack.

Depends-on: Ib29d3f5f18533115b9c51e27b373e92fc0a28d1a

Change-Id: I203163b09613734b3e792bee7e5a931f0888378e
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 13:54:52.000000000', 'message': "Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

The tls-proxy service has been enabled in devstack-gate
by default since Ocata, see change:

Ic21c0213c8ea91f3d7c30f03227af7b5a107b527

So we don't have to enable that service explicitly here,
we just need to set NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS flag
in devstack.

Depends-on: Ib29d3f5f18533115b9c51e27b373e92fc0a28d1a

Change-Id: I203163b09613734b3e792bee7e5a931f0888378e
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 15:36:57.000000000', 'message': 'Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

Test websocketproxy with TLS in the nova-next job

Can you add the api-ref in another patch? I have some sample requests here:

get a cluster:
 
curl -g -i -k -X GET \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $USER_TOKEN" \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: container-infra latest" \
-H "User-Agent: None" \
$MAGNUM_URL/v1/federations/omega-13-federation

list clusters:
curl -g -i -k -X GET \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $USER_TOKEN" \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: container-infra latest" \
-H "User-Agent: None" \
$MAGNUM_URL/v1/federations


sample create request:
req=$(cat << EOF
{
    "properties": {
        "dns-zone": "zoneA"
    },
    "hostcluster_id": "9e8984d1-2b79-434b-808a-2e12cb8ead21"
}
EOF
)

curl -g -i -k -X POST \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $USER_TOKEN" \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: container-infra latest" \
-H "User-Agent: None" \
-d "$req" \
$MAGNUM_URL/v1/federations


add/remove a cluster:
req=$(cat << EOF
[
    {
       "op": "add",
       "path": "/member_ids",
       "value": "9e8984d1-2b79-434b-808a-2e12cb8ead21"
    }
]
EOF
)
#req="{}"

curl -g -i -k -X PATCH \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $USER_TOKEN" \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: container-infra latest" \
-H "User-Agent: None" \
-d "$req" \
$MAGNUM_URL/v1/federations/omega-13-federation


Delete a cluster
curl -g -i -k -X DELETE \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $USER_TOKEN" \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: container-infra latest" \
-H "User-Agent: None" \
$MAGNUM_URL/v1/federations/omega-13-federation'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

push to queens to complete the  other patch'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit f13b7ff013c55f2c86c60aba3eb11da8133c889c'}]

commit_message:
federation api: api endpoints

this commit introduces a new '/federations'
endpoint to Magnum API, as well as its controllers,
entities and conductor handlers.

this corresponds to the first phase of the
federation-api spec. please refer to [1] for more
details.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/489609/

Change-Id: I662ac2d6ddec07b50712109541486fd26c5d21de
Partially-Implements: blueprint federation-api

commit_message:
[Docs] Merge advanced configuration into reference

The deploy guide also have appendixes pointing to the reference,
which were pointing back to the deploy guide. This is very
hard to follow. The advanced configurations and inventory should
be merged into our reference guide, to avoid duplications.

Change-Id: I2d1e653036d380c3eae6a3a4906d1db890baecb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 12:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add resource_class to fields in ironic node cache

Per the discussion in [1], the ironic nodes added to the node cache in
the ironic virt driver may be missing the required field resource_class,
as this field is not in _NODE_FIELDS. In practice, this is typically
not an issue (possibly never), as the normal code path uses a
detailed list to sync all ironic nodes, which contain all fields
(including resource_class). However, some code paths use a single
node query with the fields limited to _NODE_FIELDS, so could result in a
node in the cache without a resource_class.

This change adds resource_class to _NODE_FIELDS.

[1]
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532288/9/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py@79

Change-Id: Id84b4a47d05532d341a9b6ca2de7e9e66e1930da
Closes-Bug: #1746209
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource_class to fields in ironic node cache

Per the discussion in [1], the ironic nodes added to the node cache in
the ironic virt driver may be missing the required field resource_class,
as this field is not in _NODE_FIELDS. In practice, this is typically
not an issue (possibly never), as the normal code path uses a
detailed list to sync all ironic nodes, which contain all fields
(including resource_class). However, some code paths use a single
node query with the fields limited to _NODE_FIELDS, so could result in a
node in the cache without a resource_class.

This change adds resource_class to _NODE_FIELDS.

[1]
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532288/9/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py@79

Change-Id: Id84b4a47d05532d341a9b6ca2de7e9e66e1930da
Closes-Bug: #1746209

commit_message:
Clean nodes stuck in CLEANING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid cleaing, the
node will get stuck in the CLEANING state.

This also moves _start_service() before creating CLEANING nodes
in tests. Finally, it adds autospec to a few places where the tests
fail in a mysterious way otherwise.

Change-Id: Ia7bce4dff57569707de4fcf3002eac241a5aa85b
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1651092

commit_message:
[Docs] Simplify advanced config

This merges advanced configuration and inventory, from the
operations guide into the reference guide. This avoids
duplications of the documentation accross the guides.

Change-Id: I6fd758b89a84698b0ac8e227d97cb24914bc2066

[Docs] Move upgrade guides into ops

Simplify the documentation, to be in-line with general openstack
recommendations, and follow the proposed blueprint
bp/docs-improvements.

commit_message:
Add docs for ansible deploy interface

mostly copied from docs present in ironic-staging-drivers,
with some modifications due to some features dropped.

Change-Id: If9e82c42a03c71fd0ff0319c7a43fe80e53f9672

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 15:32:53.000000000', 'message': 'Allow sqalchemy filtering by id and uuid

These additions will allow us to filter nodes
by node uuid and id. This filter API is used
in many places throughout the code base. It is
natural to expect that this API would allow us to
filter by node id and uuid in addtion to the other
supported parameters. This also fixes a 3 year old bug.

This change from lucasagomes has a bug:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197141/

In conductor/manager.py, he calls _fail_if_in_state()
and uses the node_id as a filter. However this filter
effectively does nothing because sqalchemy does not

commit_message:
Allow sqalchemy filtering by id and uuid

These additions will allow us to filter nodes
by node uuid and id. This filter API is used
in many places throughout the code base. It is
natural to expect that this API would allow us to
filter by node id and uuid in addtion to the other
supported parameters. This also fixes a 3 year old bug.

This change from lucasagomes has a bug:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197141/

In conductor/manager.py, he calls _fail_if_in_state()
and uses the node_id as a filter. However this filter
effectively does nothing because sqalchemy does not
know how to filter by node id on the backend. My changes
fix this problem and make the API more intuitive

Closes-Bug: #1749755

Change-Id: I4efc0d5cd5d5d6108a334f954e1718203b47da0a
(cherry picked from commit 366a44a1bb4e235f6382af02962ba2a192cffa4d)

commit_message:
[Docs] Promote scale the environment

Scale the environment deserves its own chapter.
On top of that, the managing swift section is
about how scaling is done with swift clusters
(Multi-Region handling), and therefore should
be moved into scaling the environment.

Change-Id: I3a37bfefb53e229278c7ec08a8acde63614949ed

Or we just remove it from here. It is 'stable only' job and does irelevant_files really matters for stable branch changes? I mean if  we use template defined job only then also it should be ok as not much doc/reno/.rst patches on stable branches."}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-02-16 05:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-19 20:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

After chatting with Jim I'll drop the override in here:

(2:51:21 PM) corvus: mriedem: though... the irrelevant-files bit there isn't going to apply, since you also use the integrated-gate template
(2:51:50 PM) mriedem: corvus: if it doesn't apply then i should just remove that from project-config,
(2:52:06 PM) mriedem: and the job, via the template in openstack-zuul-jobs, will use the branch restriction for stable only
(2:52:21 PM) corvus: mriedem: iow, if someone pushes a change to nova/hacking/foo.py on ocata, it's not going to match the job defined on nova in project-config, but it is going to match the job defined in the template, so it'll run
(2:52:22 PM) mriedem: and nova patches on stable will just run the job regardless of the files being relevant or not
coreycb corvus 
(2:52:46 PM) mriedem: corvus: so i should just remove the faulty override from project-config, yeah?
(2:52:50 PM) mriedem: and let the template handle the branch
(2:53:09 PM) corvus: mriedem: correct, if you drop those local job invocations and rely on the template, you'll only have whatever irrelevant-files are on the job definition itself.
(2:53:26 PM) corvus: mriedem: which is the same state we're in now anyway
(2:53:52 PM) mriedem: alright
(2:54:17 PM) ianw: fungi: i have all day ... just syncing on things from scrollback
(2:54:19 PM) corvus: mriedem: the alternative is to drop the template and keep the local invocation with the nova-specific irrelevant-files.  then it'll run less often, but i'm not sure andreaf, gmann_, AJaeger are convinced that's how we should structure things.
(2:54:57 PM) corvus: good news is, we can sort all this out over beers next week :)
(2:55:07 PM) mriedem: corvus: plus then if integrated-gate changes in openstack-zuul-jobs,
(2:55:15 PM) mriedem: nova won't get those changes, and we're duplicating job defs
(2:55:16 PM) corvus: yeah, that's the downside to that approach
(2:55:16 PM) mriedem: which sucks"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-19 21:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-19 23:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

no harm to drop for jobs running on stable branch only'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

The integrated-gate job template in openstack-zuul-jobs has the
proper branch restriction on legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full
so that it won't run on stable/queens+ changes. However, the
override of the job in project-config for nova means we end up
running that job and its replacement (tempest-full) on queens+
changes.

So this change removes the override so nova changes get the job
definition, including branch restrictions and irrelevant-files,
from the template in openstack-zuul-jobs. This does mean we could
be running this job on stable/ocata or stable/pike nova changes

Change-Id: Ib5d12dbdc69a0506ea53fd130ccf816557503bae
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full for nova on queens+

The integrated-gate job template in openstack-zuul-jobs has the
proper branch restriction on legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full
so that it won't run on stable/queens+ changes. However, the
override of the job in project-config for nova means we end up
running that job and its replacement (tempest-full) on queens+
changes.

So this change removes the override so nova changes get the job
definition, including branch restrictions and irrelevant-files,
from the template in openstack-zuul-jobs. This does mean we could
be running this job on stable/ocata or stable/pike nova changes
that don't really need it, but that should be rare.

Change-Id: Ib5d12dbdc69a0506ea53fd130ccf816557503bae

commit_message:
Add validation to check if E-M-C is already in sync

If you run expand and migrate commands for the second time,
it should return a user friendly message instead of attempting
to upgrade db again.

Added a check to confirm if expand and migrate are already in
sync and return a user friendly message.

Closes-Bug: #1745360
Change-Id: Iaf2e8ae2004db03f9b7498a2c498360fec096066

commit_message:
Allow sqalchemy filtering by id and uuid

These additions will allow us to filter nodes
by node uuid and id. This filter API is used
in many places throughout the code base. It is
natural to expect that this API would allow us to
filter by node id and uuid in addtion to the other
supported parameters. This also fixes a 3 year old bug.

This change from lucasagomes has a bug:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197141/

In conductor/manager.py, he calls _fail_if_in_state()
and uses the node_id as a filter. However this filter
effectively does nothing because sqalchemy does not
know how to filter by node id on the backend. My changes
fix this problem and make the API more intuitive

Closes-Bug: #1749755

Change-Id: I4efc0d5cd5d5d6108a334f954e1718203b47da0a
(cherry picked from commit 366a44a1bb4e235f6382af02962ba2a192cffa4d)

commit_message:
Build instance PXE options for unrescue

This patch always builds PXE options for booting a user image even if
the provision state is related to rescue mode. When the state is
unrescuing, these options are necessary to boot a user image. When the
provision state is rescuing, these options are just ignored because
the PXE configuration is used at deployment mode.

Change-Id: I1ff51cab120e6612c71e5d9c45cf28797bc16e76
Closes-Bug: 1749433

[{'created': '2018-02-19 17:19:16.000000000', 'message': 'Clean nodes stuck in CLEANING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid cleaing, the
node will get stuck in the CLEANING state.

This also moves _start_service() before creating CLEANING nodes
in tests. Finally, it adds autospec to a few places where the tests
fail in a mysterious way otherwise.

Change-Id: Ia7bce4dff57569707de4fcf3002eac241a5aa85b
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1651092
(cherry picked from commit 2921fe685d8f096717f8795494c1032025407fe4)
'}]
commit_message:
Clean nodes stuck in CLEANING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid cleaing, the
node will get stuck in the CLEANING state.

This also moves _start_service() before creating CLEANING nodes
in tests. Finally, it adds autospec to a few places where the tests
fail in a mysterious way otherwise.

Change-Id: Ia7bce4dff57569707de4fcf3002eac241a5aa85b
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1651092
(cherry picked from commit 2921fe685d8f096717f8795494c1032025407fe4)

[{'created': '2018-02-19 17:18:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rare HTTP 400 from port list API

This may happen when a node is deleted in parallel with calling
the port list API. Ports are fetched, then we try do fetch their
nodes and port groups. If either of them are removed in the meantime,
the API fails with HTTP 400. This change works around it.

Change-Id: Ie2d4c46c031ee86976abb6107433cdde87a4345a
Closes-Bug: #1748893
(cherry picked from commit 52dcc642d372e23fd59be44e0f9f5627fac5cec4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rare HTTP 400 from port list API

This may happen when a node is deleted in parallel with calling
the port list API. Ports are fetched, then we try do fetch their
nodes and port groups. If either of them are removed in the meantime,
the API fails with HTTP 400. This change works around it.

Change-Id: Ie2d4c46c031ee86976abb6107433cdde87a4345a
Closes-Bug: #1748893
(cherry picked from commit 52dcc642d372e23fd59be44e0f9f5627fac5cec4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 16:11:36.000000000', 'message': "Update comment and mock about autospec not working on staticmethods

Update the comment where autospec was not used. And use spec_set.

When using a mock, 'autospec=True' doesn't work on staticmethods
(https://bugs.python.org/issue23078). For those cases, use
spec_set=types.FunctionType.

Change-Id: Ib6e7f820eb7ba402e1e62656d6b18e49aa4b00ef
"}, {'created': '2018-02-19 16:14:43.000000000', 'message': "Update comment and mock about autospec not working on staticmethods

Update the comment where autospec was not used. And use spec_set.

When using a mock, 'autospec=True' doesn't work on staticmethods
(https://bugs.python.org/issue23078). For those cases, use
spec_set=types.FunctionType.

Change-Id: Ib6e7f820eb7ba402e1e62656d6b18e49aa4b00ef
"}]
commit_message:
Update comment and mock about autospec not working on staticmethods

Update the comment where autospec was not used. And use spec_set.

When using a mock, 'autospec=True' doesn't work on staticmethods
(https://bugs.python.org/issue23078). For those cases, use
spec_set=types.FunctionType.

Change-Id: Ib6e7f820eb7ba402e1e62656d6b18e49aa4b00ef

commit_message:
Add 'overcloud_images_validate' tag

Until rhbz-1523707 is resolved validation of docker
 images/containers on oc nodes fails.
Having this tag allows to skip this validation.

Change-Id: I615e1b9d55df1dfc2718c599ca4ad370d8b739c3

tox-py27 tests in pike are broken until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540490/ merges.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-07 04:05:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The requirements-check failure is a bigger problem.  defusedxml is not listed in the pike u-c: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/pike 

I'm not sure what the odds are of getting it in; you could propose a patch to stable/pike in the requirements repo.  The policy is here:
https://docs.openstack.org/requirements/latest/#new-requirements

They really don't like introducing new requirements into a stable branch.  This is sort of a security fix, but it's to a part of the code that is already recommended to be used only by administrators, as you can see from the discussion on https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1745353 and https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1625402"}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

global-requirements for stable/pike doesn't contain defusedxml"}]

commit_message:
Replace xml defusedxml

xml was considered as vulnerable to different atacks.
It is recommended to replace this library with defused_xml

Change-Id: I2b146dc34ada37a3ed9ecf49513d024a8ca2fb19
Related-Bug: #1625402
(cherry picked from commit 6e82ea023a63b74b49d94f4e65b0a7cd3e0c49f6)

commit_message:
Fix murano authentication configuration options

Murano failed to deploy due to outdated options - it tried to
issue v2.0 Keystone requests instead of v3. With new options that
are similar to other projects deployment succeeds.

Change-Id: I1970641e47fa6f94c2c6427ef49b3160d64c33ed
Closes-Bug: #1750373

commit_message:
Populate application credential data in token

Without this patch, the token formatter does not have enough data to
construct a token created with an application credential. This means
that if the token cache is disabled or expired, when keystone goes to
create the token it will not find any application credential information
and will not recreate the application_credential_restricted parameter in
the token data. This patch creates a new Payload class for application
credentials so that the application credential ID is properly persisted
in the msgpack'd payload. It also adds more data to the token data
object so that the application credential ID and name as well as its
restricted status is available when the token is queried.

Co-authored-by: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I322a40404d8287748fe8c3a8d6dc1256d935d84a
Closes-bug: #1750415

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Correct default route handling

When re-advertising multiple prefixes with 'attract_traffic' from VRF to the
redirection VRF, the default route is only:
- Advertised when starting to readvertise the first prefix,
- Withdrawn when stopping to readvertise the last prefix.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Ib7f74aecc8be85cf55b5dcd8eaaaa480be1ecbcb
Closes-Bug: 1749910

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: Iaff058758c26fec5ae55d711b4390f37f72e79c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 20:13:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix suffix-byte-range responses for zero-byte replicated objects.

Previously, given a GET request like "Range: bytes=-12345" for a
zero-byte object, Swift would return a 206 response with the header
"Content-Range: bytes 0--1/0". This is clearly incorrect. Now Swift
returns a 200 with the whole (zero-byte) object.

Note: this does not fix the bug for EC objects, only for replicated
ones. The fix for EC objects will follow in a separate commit.

Change-Id: If1edb665b0ae000da78c4efff6faddd94d75da6b
Partial-Bug: 1736840
'}]
commit_message:
Fix suffix-byte-range responses for zero-byte replicated objects.

Previously, given a GET request like "Range: bytes=-12345" for a
zero-byte object, Swift would return a 206 response with the header
"Content-Range: bytes 0--1/0". This is clearly incorrect. Now Swift
returns a 200 with the whole (zero-byte) object.

Note: this does not fix the bug for EC objects, only for replicated
ones. The fix for EC objects will follow in a separate commit.

Change-Id: If1edb665b0ae000da78c4efff6faddd94d75da6b
Partial-Bug: 1736840

commit_message:
Convert golang tests to Zuul v3 native jobs

Convert the golang unit and fmt tests to Zuul v3 native jobs; use it in
the project-template.

Remove the legacy jobs, they were only used via the template.

commit_message:
Refactor playbooks/publish/openstack-afs.yaml

Rework the playbook so that it takes an additional parameter and we can
use it in more places (see followup change). Set the current value
as default

Note that we really need to allow a value of "{{ afs.path }}" for the
variable without trailing "/" so that publishing of openstack-manuals
works which publishes to the root folder.

Change-Id: I15b77fc002a6b099ff23e0c07972b49ad743a2c9

Ignore '409 Conflict' when adding reserved_host to aggregate

This patch modifies that masakari-engine ignores '409 Conflict'
when adding reserved_host to aggregate.

commit_message:
Do not use the 3rd argument of yaql groupBy

Due to an incompatible change in yaql, it's hard to use the aggregration
of groupBy as the behavior is completely different depending on the
version. Let's try to not rely on it.

Change-Id: I2887011f6baf4867d422579b116b5e143acf5679
Related-Bug: #1750032

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2359923d185abcd9e6ef2fa12b4b4baf45b1b8ec

commit_message:
Fixing v1 Dashboard

- Use openstack_dashboard.api.neutron instead of openstack_dashboard.api.network
- Made action_present and action_past callable.
- Fixed compatibility issues with Django.
- Removed unused import.

Change-Id: Iaa37f1ef90ee3188c7099a0accdf372191f8f509

the console output of the failed functional job actually showed a kernel panic :( that's not neutron's fault"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-02-18 05:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

After this patch i can see some failures in booting and ssh to vm in poi deployment with neutron linuxbridge:- https://centos.logs.rdoproject.org/weirdo-generic-puppet-openstack-scenario003/4452/weirdo-project/logs/testr_results.html.gz'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-20 05:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> After this patch i can see some failures in booting and ssh to vm
 > in poi deployment with neutron linuxbridge:- https://centos.logs.rdoproject.org/weirdo-generic-puppet-openstack-scenario003/4452/weirdo-project/logs/testr_results.html.gz

I got it what's the issue is. After this patch, neutron Q_AGENT=linuxbridge setup don't work(see [1] for error) on a machine where mtu = 1450 or less. Though after setting global_physnet_mtu=1450 in neutron.conf it works. Default mtu is 1500.
So is this just a config issue or this patch is not handling this scenario and is incomplete?
I would propose a revert for it so someone can look into the issue and suggest.

[1] Feb 20 05:19:03 devstack.rdocloud neutron-linuxbridge-agent[8313]: DEBUG neutron.agent.linux.utils [None req-267feaf8-dedd-4433-a725-3ff711a5f951 None None] Running command (rootwrap daemon): ['ip', 'link', 'set', 'vxlan-2', 'mtu', '1450'] {{(pid=8313) execute_rootwrap_daemon /opt/stack/neutron/neutron/agent/linux/utils.py:108}}
Feb 20 05:19:03 devstack.rdocloud neutron-linuxbridge-agent[8313]: ERROR neutron.agent.linux.utils [None req-267feaf8-dedd-4433-a725-3ff711a5f951 None None] Exit code: 2; Stdin: ; Stdout: ; Stderr: RTNETLINK answers: Invalid argument"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-20 05:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I3eccc161d54e80a9d7b29c0a57633a633c1ecd11'}]

Prad, wdyt about this one?'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The snmp daemon running on network and compute nodes is polled by the ceilometer central agent periodically to monitor phy network. So in snmpd conf, when we configure the network its usually the one where central agent is running and able to reach the compute/network nodes. So if SnmpdIpSubnet is set to internal, would that be reachable? 

Easiest way to test this is to run snmpdwalk on controller (where the central agent runs) and point to a compute or network node ip running snmpd daemon and see if we can get data back.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:32:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I think internal_api network is reachable from both controllers & compute nodes, correct? In that case, i think we're good.

What we really need to fix is to stop opening SNMP to the world."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

yea api network should be available I think'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2018-02-19 22:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> I think internal_api network is reachable from both controllers &
 > compute nodes, correct? In that case, i think we're good.
 > 
 > What we really need to fix is to stop opening SNMP to the world.

sounds good. Lgtm then!"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-20 05:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 69565d743111914d8548aa0dd54a63abed9db605'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 16:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Restrict SNMP to internal network

Add a parameter, SnmpdIpSubnet, which can be an IP/MASK that will be
used to secure with IPtables the source network authorized to reach
SNMP service on the host.
If SnmpdIpSubnet is left empty (default) the parameter will be set to
InternalApiIpSubnet.

Change-Id: I46fce28926cb5a881f7384948480266712ae75e3
Closes-Bug: #1749324
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 03:00:31.000000000', 'message': 'Restrict SNMP to internal network

'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 14:52:34.000000000', 'message': 'Restrict SNMP to internal network
