Change-Id: I46fce28926cb5a881f7384948480266712ae75e3
Closes-Bug: #1749324
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 18:24:03.000000000', 'message': "Restrict SNMP to internal network

Add a parameter, SnmpdIpSubnet, which can be an IP/MASK that will be
used to secure with IPtables the source network authorized to reach
SNMP service on the host.
If SnmpdIpSubnet is left empty (default) the parameter will be set to
InternalApiIpSubnet.

Also change the IPtables id, 127 was used by Horizon, so let's switch
SNMP to 124. No impact on users.

Change-Id: I46fce28926cb5a881f7384948480266712ae75e3
Closes-Bug: #1749324
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 21:55:33.000000000', 'message': "Restrict SNMP to internal network

Add a parameter, SnmpdIpSubnet, which can be an IP/MASK that will be
used to secure with IPtables the source network authorized to reach
SNMP service on the host.
If SnmpdIpSubnet is left empty (default) the parameter will be set to
SnmpNetwork.

commit_message:
Restrict SNMP to internal network

Add a parameter, SnmpdIpSubnet, which can be an IP/MASK that will be
used to secure with IPtables the source network authorized to reach
SNMP service on the host.
If SnmpdIpSubnet is left empty (default) the parameter will be set to
SnmpdNetwork.

Also change the IPtables id, 127 was used by Horizon, so let's switch
SNMP to 124. No impact on users.

Change-Id: I46fce28926cb5a881f7384948480266712ae75e3
Closes-Bug: #1749324

[{'created': '2018-02-09 02:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup /etc/sysconfig/iptables on stack update

When running a stack update, puppetlabs-firewall will execute:

  service iptables save

Which will export all running iptables rules into
/etc/sysconfig/iptables to make the rules consistent.

We don't want Neutron-managed rules to be consistent, so we need to
remove them from /etc/sysconfig/iptables so if iptables is restarted,
it won't fail because of some missing namespaces managed by Neutron.

See more context on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541528

Related-Bug: #1747960

Related-Bug: #1747960

commit_message:
Cleanup /etc/sysconfig/iptables on stack update

When running a stack update, puppetlabs-firewall will execute:

  service iptables save

Which will export all running iptables rules into
/etc/sysconfig/iptables to make the rules consistent.

We don't want Neutron-managed rules to be consistent, so we need to
remove them from /etc/sysconfig/iptables so if iptables is restarted,
it won't fail because of some missing namespaces managed by Neutron.

See more context on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541528

Change-Id: Ia38d8e1800c91094f0bdd8744ee608e1757c7d66
Related-Bug: #1747960

run of the container.

commit_message:
Add Puppet package to bindep, for module build

We need Puppet package deployed from bindep so we can
run puppet module build with the new zuul v3 job.

Change-Id: I40ffb35357fafe13c1e871d55060fdc26f00075e

commit_message:
Update documentation for DNS integration

- Split documentation for external DNS integration into a new document
- Update configs to current standards
- Remove use of old designate client

Change-Id: I7a50ad72e35e2c01f874b872ddeff1aa8bfe3424
Closes-Bug: 1722367
Related-Bug: 1725630

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 21:15:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix db migration for mariadb >= 10.2.8

Starting with mariadb 10.2.8, removing a column
that is part of a primary key requires that the
primary key constraint be dropped and recreated.

Change-Id: I43e4dae325dd6561a9fe0fd4ce595cea4c2ef7a6
Closes-Bug: #1749184
(cherry picked from commit 2beb7ac13ab640c6178a711fc39c75bd71b2bc2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix db migration for mariadb >= 10.2.8

Starting with mariadb 10.2.8, removing a column
that is part of a primary key requires that the
primary key constraint be dropped and recreated.

Change-Id: I43e4dae325dd6561a9fe0fd4ce595cea4c2ef7a6
Closes-Bug: #1749184
(cherry picked from commit 2beb7ac13ab640c6178a711fc39c75bd71b2bc2c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 23:44:36.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I58b60d0167b74c27988c2d90799e8eb943147058
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I58b60d0167b74c27988c2d90799e8eb943147058

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 07:13:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use fernet in gates

we have gates currently broken due using rocky keystone code.
we have no way to test our release until we branch out queens.
this change doesnt change globals default, only our gates tests.

Change-Id: I189aa8cafc73a365668d79e4b186aac21da63a6f
'}]
commit_message:
Use fernet in gates

we have gates currently broken due using rocky keystone code.
we have no way to test our release until we branch out queens.
this change doesnt change globals default, only our gates tests.

Change-Id: I189aa8cafc73a365668d79e4b186aac21da63a6f

commit_message:
Add reno for manila generic driver removal

A recent change [1] removed dysfunctional environment templates
for manila with the "generic" back end.  Add a release note for
same.

[1] I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388

Change-Id: Iaca0250361055d5175fc93814334cd393e959395

commit_message:
Add Puppet package to bindep, for module build

We need Puppet package deployed from bindep so we can
run puppet module build with the new zuul v3 job.

Change-Id: Ia3737ec37117c05522066ef9b39f9b36f311fc7b

[{'created': '2018-02-13 13:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I67d29bd9245736f08ed56d93ad62f31b73432d9e
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I67d29bd9245736f08ed56d93ad62f31b73432d9e

consistency group snapshots are created on lsses reserved for cg.
This limits the number of snapshots and possible groups. This
patch is used to implement that CG snapshots should not create
on lssed which reserverd for CG by lss_range_for_cg

'}]
commit_message:
DS8K: correct LSS behavior for CG snapshots

consistency group snapshots are created on lsses reserved for cg.
This limits the number of snapshots and possible groups. This
patch is used to implement that CG snapshots should not create
on lssed which reserverd for CG by lss_range_for_cg

Change-Id: I25af120e3c19d90c8a124fb9621cae11ec5d4865
Closes-Bug: 1740826

commit_message:
Remove outdated comment in .zuul.yaml

This removes the outdated comment in .zuul.yaml. We already have not
only master branch job but also stable/queens now. And we don't have
the negative lookup anymore.

Change-Id: I8c66502832250a00c4ec1e7c89387d67fa093e0d

commit_message:
Add the ability to get absolute limits from Cinder

This will be used in a later patch to check quota usage
for volume snapshots before attempting to create new
volume snapshots, so we can avoid an OverLimit error.

Change-Id: Ica7c087708e86494d285fc3905a5740fd1356e5f
Related-Bug: #1731986

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 10:41:52.000000000', 'message': "overcloud-deploy-post: detect keystone with undercloud's credentials

The current code path for detecting if keystone was deployed uses the
overcloud's credentials. This is not correct, as the output will
probably not be available there (unless you deployed a stack with a
similar output... but that would be quite a coincidence). So, this moves
the sourcing of the overcloud's credentials after getting the stack
output.

Change-Id: I5772dae90e7bfeba72440045ba3c772134ccc947
"}]
commit_message:
overcloud-deploy-post: detect keystone with undercloud's credentials

The current code path for detecting if keystone was deployed uses the
overcloud's credentials. This is not correct, as the output will
probably not be available there (unless you deployed a stack with a
similar output... but that would be quite a coincidence). So, this moves
the sourcing of the overcloud's credentials after getting the stack
output.

Change-Id: I5772dae90e7bfeba72440045ba3c772134ccc947

commit_message:
Add tripleo-upgrade to cloned projects for reproducer script

This mirrors what is done in the software factory jjb[1], so that
reproducer script based jobs will have the tripleo-upgrade project
checked out with any zuul_changes.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#q,I65d86f1165275d14033b6f132c34e3f0ef7e86b8,n,z

Change-Id: I8cfc04ead34061ad0d046ea0118e48075f32f538

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic4927711d067b95995f76e3ce0961ec36c3e8255

commit_message:
OVB: use "ipmi" driver instead of "pxe_ipmitool" for >= Queens

The classic drivers (pxe_*, agent_* and iscsi_*) are deprecated in
Queens and will be removed in Rocky. This change uses the new
--driver argument to build-nodes-json to specify the driver to use.

Change-Id: If51505c4cd53918200b65c75915e389adaddb200

commit_message:
Purge resolv.conf from the overcloud images

When building the images we should not be including any values in the
resolv.conf. This change adds the element to clear it for the
overcloud-full, hardened and realtime compute images.

Depends-On: If8c44137d120059b356675a074e3af23ea63a6f8
Change-Id: Ib2531e0a696915ab980aea5a65a425789938786c
Closes-Bug: #1749756

commit_message:
Add --dry-run option to undercloud install

This will help greatly with the development of the --use-heat path by
printing the underlying "undercloud deploy" command instead of
executing it. This may also help debug undercloud install issues in
the field.

Change-Id: I42ce297e5663ff782cfb6afa9058daf8abdf389b
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 22323, 'name': 'Michael  Henkel', 'email': 'mhenkel@juniper.net', 'username': 'mhenkel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 15:33:37.000000000', 'message': 'Composable role and service fails workflow

When defining a resource_registry for a composable service, the workflow fails
because it validates before the user-environment is added.
This patch moves the workflow invocation after the creation of the user-
environment.
This is caused by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511249/ which changes the
behaviour of the action in tripleo-common.

Change-Id: Idf17e3f817708d9e7dd7241063434ce56b6be052
Closes-Bug: 1743575
(cherry picked from commit 7c0ad1df5e49358299cea3cd15ccdd6d2c54271d)
'}]
commit_message:
Composable role and service fails workflow

When defining a resource_registry for a composable service, the workflow fails
because it validates before the user-environment is added.
This patch moves the workflow invocation after the creation of the user-
environment.
This is caused by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511249/ which changes the
behaviour of the action in tripleo-common.

Change-Id: Idf17e3f817708d9e7dd7241063434ce56b6be052
Closes-Bug: 1743575
(cherry picked from commit 7c0ad1df5e49358299cea3cd15ccdd6d2c54271d)

There was one code path where the existing device_owner

Change-Id: Ic13901b92cac05e8ddf1092b66aa5bcc5623fa8a

(cherry picked from commit 0d4889df41485cece4bef5915753ae7efd808138)

commit_message:
Always pass device_owner to _ipam_get_subnets()

There was one code path where the existing device_owner
value, which is used for subnet selection when service_type's
are in use was not passed to _imap_get_subnets().  This could
trigger one of two exceptions - HostNotCompatibleWithFixedIps()
or IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() depending
on the environment.  Pass it along if known.

Also update the IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet
exception to print the network_id and service_type values since
it could aid in debugging the problem quicker.

Change-Id: Ic13901b92cac05e8ddf1092b66aa5bcc5623fa8a
Closes-bug: #1637366
(cherry picked from commit 0d4889df41485cece4bef5915753ae7efd808138)

commit_message:
Update all test base classes to use base.TestCase

We have a centrally defined test case base class that handles a set of
things like log capture, mocking time.sleep and setting up
requests-mock.

We also had a split base test case, with some things using TestCase and
some using RequestsMockTestCase. This was a holdover from the transition
to requests-mock. We are finally at the point where we don't need the
split, so merge TestCase and RequestsMockTest case.

Then, update all of the tests to use the new combined base class.

Also, replace a use of unittest.skipTest with self.skipTest from the
base class.

Change-Id: I2cc3e201a5241262e5d102d3de8423c4fb2a8c4a

commit_message:
Update base test case to use base from oslotest

We can get rid of our custom stdout/stderr handling by doing this. We
should push our 'attach-on-exception' code up to oslotest so we can get
rid of it locally.

Remove a direct mock of time.sleep. This is already handled in
the base test case. Also remove a time.sleep(40) - because of all of the
reasons.

Set the default for timeout to 3 seconds. Sometimes an error will cause
a requests-mock test to spin in an infinite loop. All of the unit tests
run in under a second and should stay that way.

Change-Id: I7f9ea357a85754a6d3f79955d3ffb2a68a0ff621

commit_message:
Always pass device_owner to _ipam_get_subnets()

There was one code path where the existing device_owner
value, which is used for subnet selection when service_type's
are in use was not passed to _imap_get_subnets().  This could
trigger one of two exceptions - HostNotCompatibleWithFixedIps()
or IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() depending
on the environment.  Pass it along if known.

Also update the IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet
exception to print the network_id and service_type values since
it could aid in debugging the problem quicker.

Change-Id: Ic13901b92cac05e8ddf1092b66aa5bcc5623fa8a
Closes-bug: #1637366
(cherry picked from commit 0d4889df41485cece4bef5915753ae7efd808138)

commit_message:
Fix filtering by admin_state_up

Filtering list calls by admin_state_up would fail with values other than 1 or
0. The boolean conversion code was being skipped because the field key was
already translated from 'admin_state_up' to 'enabled' and the code was
expecting 'admin_state_up'.

Change-Id: I17b2569603a4d33c37a8a06c8cff6db4357b6099
Story: 2001555
Task: 6497

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 16:35:34.000000000', 'message': "trivial: Don't use 'Test' prefix for non-TestCase classes

The collectors for most Python test runners identify tests based on
class or function name, Using 'Test' in the name of non-TestCase derived
classes causes issues for some runners, such as 'pytest'. Just rename
the offending classes.

Change-Id: Id9ea6302778bae4d8cc7ba62ba39c0ad3f32603a
"}]
commit_message:
trivial: Don't use 'Test' prefix for non-TestCase classes

The collectors for most Python test runners identify tests based on
class or function name, Using 'Test' in the name of non-TestCase derived
classes causes issues for some runners, such as 'pytest'. Just rename
the offending classes.

Change-Id: Id9ea6302778bae4d8cc7ba62ba39c0ad3f32603a

Fix syntax error when running tools with py3

Trivial issue where print is now a function and therefore
needs () to avoid a syntax error.

 to indicate the point you made as well ?'}, {'account_id': 19944, 'date': '2017-12-18 10:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@jichenjc Thanks for the review.
The description of cloud-init from 'doc/source/admin/admin-password-injection.rst' has nothing to do with the 'inject_password from nova.conf.libvirt ', which is a libvirt related config.
The inject_password conf of libvirt is a guestfs related configuration.
Libvirt did not control cloud-init.
PS: cloud-init can change admin password both in windwos and linux, so the what the admin-password-injection.rst said is OK."}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-12-18 13:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
libvirt: add Linux distribution guest only description for inject_xxx options

Actually, inject_password, inject_key and inject_partition
by libguestfs is only valid for linux guest.
Add some descriptions for these.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I5b2ef7d677a1d2d47052df5eaf8726cfc02eea1c
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

commit_message:
Node Labels: update nodelabels to allow targeting of pods to nodes

This PS updates the node labels to allow pods to be targeted to nodes
on a per type basis.

Change-Id: I45d5383d04fcd1d98740a18d86c1cfc2cb8ec409

[{'created': '2018-01-22 11:21:33.000000000', 'message': "Do not multiply megabytes with 1024 to get gigabytes.

The were tests actually not affected, since the multiplied value of
reserved_host_disk_mb is set to 0 by default.
Still, let's adapt confusing lines.

Change-Id: I686fd2e7aa3973c689ee8320a777c9845adfda46
"}, {'created': '2018-01-22 13:17:44.000000000', 'message': "Do not multiply megabytes with 1024 to get gigabytes.

The tests were actually not failing, since the value
of reserved_host_disk_mb is set to 0 by default.
Still, let's adapt confusing lines.

Change-Id: I686fd2e7aa3973c689ee8320a777c9845adfda46
"}]
commit_message:
Do not multiply megabytes with 1024 to get gigabytes.

The tests were actually not failing, since the value
of reserved_host_disk_mb is set to 0 by default.
Still, let's adapt confusing lines.

commit_message:
Fix PatternPropertiesTestCase for py 3.6

A python version check was only checking for 3.5. As noted
in the pre-existing comment, an exception message is not a
particularly stable interface so specific-to-minor-version
check is maintained.

Change-Id: I441b90e911fbac033e8cdea96114db22cba96ac5
Closes-Bug: #1750355

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Comment out job, over running as non-voting.

Change-Id: I02e9dcafdb6e91451f630bb78be702009726a1ea
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

This PS names all the heat engine "heat-engine" by default. This should
make the number of dead engines simple to manage following updates.

commit_message:
Use get_session_client in Connection

The openstack.config CloudRegion object knows how to make adapters, but
we make them by hand in Connection. Add a constructor parameter and
shift to using get_session_client from CloudRegion to make the proxy
objects instead of duplicating the call. This should help us get version
discovery plugged in properly.

Change-Id: I486d1fc82ba9a1f1aafaf83e9a6ed8f01244ede6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 18:51:27.000000000', 'message': "Change logging for source downloads and wheel build

In I298dd45ada552b78ef7d6fcb79481035581bd77a timestamping
for the wheel build process was added, but it wasn't added
to the source download process. This patch adds timestamping
to the source download process too, but also changes the log
file used for each step so that they each have their own log
files.

The two tasks are also normalised to execute in the same way
to make them a little easier to follow. It thereby removes
the extra indirection of using yet another script for the
execution.

Change-Id: If571e9d290cbdd5ba02542b6bc19e4321b67ea6f
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Change logging for source downloads and wheel build

In I298dd45ada552b78ef7d6fcb79481035581bd77a timestamping
for the wheel build process was added, but it wasn't added
to the source download process. This patch adds timestamping
to the source download process too, but also changes the log
file used for each step so that they each have their own log
files.

The two tasks are also normalised to execute in the same way
to make them a little easier to follow. It thereby removes
the extra indirection of using yet another script for the
execution.

Change-Id: If571e9d290cbdd5ba02542b6bc19e4321b67ea6f
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Fix a typo in build.sh

change the default value assiagment for container_tech from - to :- in 
case the the parameter has been declared, but is null.

The extra : makes a difference only when parameter has been declared, 
but is null.

commit_message:
RBAC: Include release name in cluster roles to prevent collision

This PS includes the release name in the cluster role to prevent
colision if the chart is deployed multiple times in the same
cluster.

Change-Id: I7166e5ee25b3d4c89879393c5f84c869585a2681

commit_message:
Set rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to 0 for ceph::rgw::keystone

Ceph RGW defaults to checking every 600 seconds for a revocation.
This is only useful for PKI tokens. PKI is not enabled. This check
needs to be disabled.

Partial-Bug: #1748137
Change-Id: I2487ce8e5cb5d3dc0d7fb8e547a4abe0e086ff4b

commit_message:
Remove deprecated aggregate DB compatibility

We dropped support for aggregates in newton, so this compatibility code
should no longer be used or needed.

Related to blueprint placement-req-filter

Change-Id: Iec161b0b13b5d3fe655531eacad83193fea89fda

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 15:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes gnocchi with postgresql deployment if running on different hosts

a) The db-init method ignores the configured admin password.

This seems to work if db-init was scheduled to the same host as
postgresql is running on but fails on a remote connection. This change
sets the PGPASSWORD variable to the provided admin password.

b) Fixed liveness and readiness probe for postgresql

While this seems to work it continously outputs the message
"psql: FATAL: role "root" does not exist"

This change adds the admin username as argument to pg_isready
to stop this message.

Change-Id: I59b47a8724065d08203c29172c15350aaa785203
Closes-Bug: #1749177
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 15:49:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes gnocchi with postgresql deployment if running on different hosts

commit_message:
Fixes gnocchi with postgresql deployment if running on different hosts

a) The db-init method ignores the configured admin password.

This seems to work if db-init was scheduled to the same host as
postgresql is running on but fails on a remote connection. This change
sets the PGPASSWORD variable to the provided admin password.

b) Fixed liveness and readiness probe for postgresql

While this seems to work it continously outputs the message
"psql: FATAL: role "root" does not exist"

This change adds the admin username as argument to pg_isready
to stop this message.

Update: Making the linter happy ;-)

Change-Id: I59b47a8724065d08203c29172c15350aaa785203
Closes-Bug: #1749177

Change-Id: I3a5f9eb2689f01ee2ef216843b80fbe2607eb5bc
'}]
commit_message:
Dev-Deploy: move to k8s DNS addr for private network

This PS moves the DNS nameservers used in the smoketest heat
template to use the k8s DNS on the dev host.

Change-Id: I3a5f9eb2689f01ee2ef216843b80fbe2607eb5bc

> (1 comment)

Yes - they passed 90% of the time - we just need to retry for upto 45 seconds for the public ingress rules to be populated - if the service is not responding after then - we have failed. || is not the right path here."}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-01-18 00:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

i fine with the general idea here for this WIP

"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 15:28:29.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] fix gate

'openstack ...' command syntax is picky and sometimes doesn't work;
try to make it a little more robust for the gates.

Change-Id: I6c6e719f8eeb8d4214ebb0111e9d8f8b659db396
"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 17:53:30.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] fix gate

'openstack ...' command syntax is picky and sometimes doesn't work;
try to make it a little more robust for the gates.

ipcalc isn't always present and installable from the available repos,
as a fallback we grab a pre-built binary and use that; the current
binary should work on amd64 an most any current distro.

Change-Id: I6c6e719f8eeb8d4214ebb0111e9d8f8b659db396
"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 19:19:55.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] fix gate

The 'openstack ...' commands are have changed over time, try to be
more robust.  In some cases we see timeouts (slow hosts) which we can
ignore - important problems will be detected later.

If ipcalc isn't present and installable, fallback to using a pre-built
binary.  The current binary should work on any reasonable amd64
machine.

Change-Id: I6c6e719f8eeb8d4214ebb0111e9d8f8b659db396
"}, {'created': '2018-01-17 20:44:03.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] fix gate

The 'openstack ...' commands are have changed over time, try to be
more robust.  In some cases we see timeouts (slow hosts) which we can
ignore - important problems will be detected later.

If ipcalc isn't present and available, fallback to using a pre-built
binary.  The current binary should work on any reasonable amd64
machine.

Disable ingress UDP *:53 until we that works with hosts where that is
occupied.

Change-Id: I6c6e719f8eeb8d4214ebb0111e9d8f8b659db396

Use a utility container for ipcalc on all platforms; this avoids
having to find the package on platforms where it's not easily
available and we avoid argument differences.

Disable ingress UDP *:53 until we have a mechanism that works
everywhere.

Use "openstack object create" in a more robust (simpler) manner.

commit_message:
gate: utility container

Use a utility container for ipcalc on all platforms; this avoids
having to find the package on platforms where it's not easily
available and we avoid argument differences.

Change-Id: I6c6e719f8eeb8d4214ebb0111e9d8f8b659db396

[{'created': '2018-02-19 17:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix support for k8s-client 4.0

The new release of kubernetes python client improved the validation,
so we need to ediot our test to create the right fake objects.
As well, kubernetes.client.ConnectionObject was renamed to just `Connection`
and we should handle this.

Change-Id: I1a3275a8a5a3d729ce507689ab38e3c3d54d3c77
'}]
commit_message:
Fix support for k8s-client 4.0

The new release of kubernetes python client improved the validation,
so we need to ediot our test to create the right fake objects.
As well, kubernetes.client.ConnectionObject was renamed to just `Connection`
and we should handle this.

Change-Id: I1a3275a8a5a3d729ce507689ab38e3c3d54d3c77

commit_message:
Fix Ceph Grafana dashboard

Two incorrect expressions were causing issues in reporting the
number of OSDs In and the number of OSDs Down. This updates the
expressions to fix these issues

Change-Id: I41c3588a227edc8fe986061886a27d1f694d6e92

commit_message:
Add rules files to prometheus dynamically

This dynamically adds the rules files for prometheus to the
prometheus-etc configmap, and also dynamically adds volume mounts
to the prometheus statefulset for each rules file

This also removes the empty rules file trees in the prometheus
values.yaml file

Change-Id: I9acbbe57d71a23f69e9e172b2f3ad66985e99574

commit_message:
[rally] Add a separate repository for OpenStack plugins

We, Rally team, decided to move OpenStack plugins into separate
repository which simplify managing releases and dependencies as well.

This patch introduces rally-openstack repository which should be
imported from https://github.com/andreykurilin/rally-openstack

Needed-By: Ib6ac80994cbc72af5b1a85a17e22431cc0821311
Change-Id: I4269ae2cae08ef7784ca1d5c107cace101a1209e

commit_message:
Expose bug in application credential token validation

This change exposes an issue when validating a token obtained with
an application credential. Not all properties are rebuilt when the
cache is dropped. A subsequent patch will fix this behavior.

Change-Id: I5cb4923b9960cfe438b03bce8a4a8989fbfc905d

the volume may already have an attachment created (or the volume

This patch adds a test to check that these volume attachments
are deleted and removed once the instance has been deleted. It
also adds some functionality to allow checking when an volume
has been reserved in the Cinder fixtures.

commit_message:
Add functional tests to ensure BDM removal on delete

In certain cases, such as when an instance fails to be scheduled,
the volume may already have an attachment created (or the volume
has been reserved in the old flows).

This patch adds a test to check that these volume attachments
are deleted and removed once the instance has been deleted. It
also adds some functionality to allow checking when an volume
has been reserved in the Cinder fixtures.

Change-Id: I85cc3998fbcde30eefa5429913ca287246d51255
Related-Bug: #1404867

commit_message:
Store block device mappings in cell0

If an instance fails to get scheduled, it gets buried in cell0 but
none of it's block device mappings are stored.  At the API layer,
Nova reserves and creates attachments for new instances when
it gets a create request so these attachments are orphaned if the
block device mappings are not registered in the database somewhere.

This patch makes sure that if an instance is being buried in cell0,
all of it's block device mappings are recorded as well so they can
be later removed when the instance is deleted.

Change-Id: I64074923fb741fbf5459f66b8ab1a23c16f3303f
Related-Bug: #1404867

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 01:18:55.000000000', 'message': "Use 'attach_status' for attachment status in Cinder fixtures

The Cinder test fixtures are erroneously setting volume['status'] with
attachment statuses. Volume statuses include 'available' and 'in-use'
whereas attachment statuses include 'attached' and 'detached'.

Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
"}, {'created': '2018-02-01 02:35:00.000000000', 'message': "Use 'attach_status' for attachment status in Cinder fixtures

The Cinder test fixtures are erroneously setting volume['status'] with
attachment statuses. Volume statuses include 'available' and 'in-use'
whereas attachment statuses include 'attached' and 'detached'.

Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 00:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'Drop extra loop which modifies Cinder volume status

There is an existing loop which sets the proper value for status
and attach_status right above, so this is doing nothing other than
changing it to the incorrect value.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 00:27:45.000000000', 'message': 'Drop extra loop which modifies Cinder volume status

There is an existing loop which sets the proper value for status
and attach_status right above, so this is doing nothing other than

Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66
'}]
commit_message:
Drop extra loop which modifies Cinder volume status

There is an existing loop which sets the proper value for status
and attach_status right above, so this is doing nothing other than
changing it to the incorrect value.

Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: Iea0c1ea0a699b9519f66977391202956f17aac66

commit_message:
Fix publishing tagged docs

Using copy and remote_src does not work recursively. Use "cp" command
directly instead.

Change-Id: I8f94edf807fb4c320d72526633c40d7d3d9a0a0c

commit_message:
Fix db migration for mariadb >= 10.2.8

Starting with mariadb 10.2.8, removing a column
that is part of a primary key requires that the
primary key constraint be dropped and recreated.

Change-Id: I43e4dae325dd6561a9fe0fd4ce595cea4c2ef7a6
Closes-Bug: #1749184

commit_message:
Fix galera deployment when stack's name has capital letters

The galera resource agent generates a mapping of pacemaker node
name (shortname) to galera node name (FQDN). Fix the generated
mapping when stack's name uses capital letters.

Change-Id: Ica82e44852bae81931b4c87acd71b90656812061
Closes-Bug: #1748927

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 14:12:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cinder_service_region undefined

Due to the simplification of group vars [1], we've removed the
definition of cinder_service_region for magnum.

We could put cinder_service_region in all group vars instead,
but it looks like the scoping is done wrong.
We should instead rely on save defaults on the role, that can
be overriden.

Here, we introduce the variable magnum_cinder_service_region,
which defaults to magnum_service_region, i.e. "RegionOne".

We can remove the need for an override that way, and properly
scope variables.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504804/18/group_vars/all/cinder.yml

Depends-On: Ia8417bbdac3f515e42d1ed760110a63ae14f8f00

Change-Id: Id25c2d344859adfd09108b759d55f11ae83f97a9

commit_message:
Fix cinder_service_region undefined

Due to the simplification of group vars [1], we've removed the
definition of cinder_service_region for magnum.

We could put cinder_service_region in all group vars instead,
but it looks like the scoping is done wrong.
We should instead rely on save defaults on the role, that can
be overriden.

Here, we introduce the variable magnum_cinder_service_region,
which defaults to magnum_service_region, i.e. "RegionOne".

We can remove the need for an override that way, and properly
scope variables.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504804/18/group_vars/all/cinder.yml

Depends-On: Ia8417bbdac3f515e42d1ed760110a63ae14f8f00

Change-Id: Id25c2d344859adfd09108b759d55f11ae83f97a9
(cherry picked from commit cf0a3c9bac18d09e44c71023b96a2da522adea37)

In general, it looks pretty good, although I am not convinced that we need two passes over config.json (please include a comment explaning).'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2017-12-14 10:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18904, 'date': '2017-12-14 10:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Thank you all for the reviews.
Dan, The 2 parses are required to allow the VFs to get created (if required) in the first parse. Only after it is created we will be able to get the device name of the VF. Please advise if there are any other alternatives.

Saravanan, I haven't checked the alternatives on the service part yet. So I haven't made any changes there for now."}, {'account_id': 22865, 'date': '2017-12-14 11:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It would be good to have this not WIP, but tests are required for that.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-01-09 19:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This looks really good, but I suspect that we should combine the sriov_pf.json/yaml and sriov_vf.json/yaml samples, so we would have sriov_pf_vf.json/yaml. I think this makes sense, because you wouldn't configure a PF without a VF, right? And certainly one would not configure a VF without a PF. Other than that, I think this is ready to merge."}, {'account_id': 26553, 'date': '2018-02-02 01:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-02-05 06:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

commit_message:
Add network objects sriov_vf and sriov_pf

sriov_pf: configure numvfs of the device, create and enable
sriov_numvfs service for the persistence of the numvfs
configuration across reboots.
sriov_vf: configure the ifcfgs for the Vfs

Change-Id: I0e55d1556328fcb90b66c898c534b76e41ca9618
Implements: blueprint sriov-vfs-as-network-interface

commit_message:
Allow passing custom openshift-ansible playbook

This allows deploying openshift from the packaged openshift-ansible or
from a git checkout more easily, by setting the
OpenShiftAnsiblePlaybook heat environment variable.

Change-Id: I60594faa10dfd817d94038b3938d7de269330e2e

commit_message:
Allow for multiple playbooks to be run

This will allow us to run multiple playbooks instead of just a
single playbook. This depends on the two changes that split
the ovb and multinode playbooks.

Depends-On: I6cc171641c8390e458eb474be3479e732eb2c985

Change-Id: I461a83a3d1b162457a2f607736ca4feb7fdd3e14

commit_message:
container-images: support cont. u/c w/ HAproxy & keepalived

Add support for containerized HAproxy & Keepalived undercloud services
when building containers.

Change-Id: I941c508c24c984e286a73d2e52a58be2d7ab1211

commit_message:
Simplify FastForwardRepoArgs structure used in FFU repo selection.

The current structure is unnecessarily complex forcing the use of
json_query filter with a parameter.  The quoting inside that line
become hard to read and is currently failing.

We change the structure to a simple hash, as this is currently all
what is needed.

Change-Id: I17f2d1b4e549e275d7d6a675cd522c6b567815ac
Closes-Bug: #1749911

commit_message:
Fix chown command for tripleo validation.

This change will allow the current changes in the sudoers file to
execute correctly. The fix will match how sudo expects the workflow
call to be performed.

Change-Id: I5b790820bcec207ff7ceff1a23b3ed22858e5a52

commit_message:
Fix a typo in docker_puppet_apply.sh

In change Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca we did a refactoring
of the puppet apply commmands into a single script. A typo slipped in
where we set FACTOR_uuid instead of FACTER_uuid

Change-Id: If67d1bbf50d4fdaffa14e197dffc90f5b1577712
Closes-Bug: #1750000
(cherry picked from commit dc811f803af6f81c15a11c3239e72c096283cfd4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 09:32:58.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Enable *_use_fqdn in ceph-ansible when EnableInternalTLS"

puppet-ceph assigns the ceph-mon IDs using puppet's $::hostname [1] which I believe to be always the shortname of the node

the fix for ceph-ansible in [2] should be sufficient to deal with case in which the socket is named after the fqdn

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/profile/mon.pp#L26
2. https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/bdcc52b96dc1f9c99ce490117170f644623d4846

This reverts commit 17a7c255c02c8cb5babd1b426c3a7a7c20273580.

Change-Id: Ie95fd5745ed6753f6406c2a720fceced50ec9ad3
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable *_use_fqdn in ceph-ansible when EnableInternalTLS"

puppet-ceph assigns the ceph-mon IDs using puppet's $::hostname [1] which I believe to be always the shortname of the node

the fix for ceph-ansible in [2] should be sufficient to deal with case in which the socket is named after the fqdn

1. https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceph/blob/master/manifests/profile/mon.pp#L26
2. https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/bdcc52b96dc1f9c99ce490117170f644623d4846

This reverts commit 17a7c255c02c8cb5babd1b426c3a7a7c20273580.

Change-Id: Ie95fd5745ed6753f6406c2a720fceced50ec9ad3

commit_message:
Adding new config parameters for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

UCSM ML2 driver now supports the following additional
configuration parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Change-Id: Ie74f1b9653894f8c717156beb604dae9d9e60e6a
(cherry picked from commit b2d76220f09b5ea2b67af91f43d0a26e4f26dce9)

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
messages: [{'account_id': 26151, 'date': '2017-11-09 06:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-09 06:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ie85f5ae13ebb3f6b320c8790da9d23427ed65ffb
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Ie85f5ae13ebb3f6b320c8790da9d23427ed65ffb

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 20:12:24.000000000', 'message': 'unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

This patch adds an exception catch to "snapshot_volume_backed()" of
compute/api.py that catches (at the moment) _all_ exceptions from the
underlying cinderclient. If the instance is queiseced ( frozen
filesystem ) then the exception will break execution of the function,
skipping the needed unquiesce, and leave the instance in a frozen state.

Additionally, this patch handles the case where the exception was raised
in the middle of a list of volumes and will issue a delete to all volume
snapshots that did complete. The reasoning is that we could not complete
the user's request so don't leave a half-finished job lying around.

Change-Id: I60de179c72eede6746696f29462ee9d805dace47
Implements: blueprint thaw-filesystem-on-failed-snapshot
Closes-bug: #1731986
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 23:06:14.000000000', 'message': 'unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

This patch adds an exception catch to "snapshot_volume_backed()" of
compute/api.py that catches (at the moment) _all_ exceptions from the
underlying cinderclient. Previously, if the instance is queiseced ( frozen
filesystem ) then the exception will break execution of the function,
skipping the needed unquiesce, and leave the instance in a frozen state.

Now, the exception catch will unquiesce the instance if it was prior to
the failure.

Change-Id: I60de179c72eede6746696f29462ee9d805dace47
Implements: blueprint thaw-filesystem-on-failed-snapshot
Closes-bug: #1731986
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 23:46:34.000000000', 'message': 'unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

the failure.

Got a unit test in place with the help of Matt Riedemann.

commit_message:
unquiesce instance on volume snapshot failure

This patch adds an exception catch to "snapshot_volume_backed()" of
compute/api.py that catches (at the moment) _all_ exceptions from the
underlying cinderclient. Previously, if the instance is quiesced ( frozen
filesystem ) then the exception will break execution of the function,
skipping the needed unquiesce, and leave the instance in a frozen state.

Now, the exception catch will unquiesce the instance if it was prior to
the failure.

Got a unit test in place with the help of Matt Riedemann.
    test_snapshot_volume_backed_with_quiesce_create_snap_fails

Change-Id: I60de179c72eede6746696f29462ee9d805dace47
Closes-bug: #1731986

[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-03 16:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-04 09:42:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From IRC:

<stephenfin> Morning o/ Would anyone be able to advise me on what's happening here with the openstack-tox-functional + privsep test? https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530961/

<frickler> stephenfin: iiuc sudo access is removed for tox tests, so starting the privsep daemon fails here http://logs.openstack.org/61/530961/1/check/openstack-tox-functional/b033cc9/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-03_16_51_01_314525

<stephenfin> frickler: Ah, it's a tox thing

* stephenfin initially thought permissions issues, but then realized you'd need sudo for DevStack stuff

<AJaeger> stephenfin: mordred has been working on some tox tests with sudo enabled - best discuss with him the status there and whether this would help your case

<stephenfin> AJaeger: Sounds like a good call. Yet more work for mordred"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the dependent change adds the needed job...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-05 06:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-05 09:34:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

hi stephen cool to see you started this.
i went on vacation before i could.

looks like this is your error

http://logs.openstack.org/61/530961/2/check/openstack-tox-functional-with-sudo/dac744a/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-05_07_05_21_261374

looks like we are missing the privsep-helper script.
which should be created when oslo.privsep is installed in the venv.
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/master/setup.cfg#L40

Looking at the command 
['sudo', 'privsep-helper', '--privsep_context', ....
sudo is being invoked with our '-E -H' so the current users environment and home directory are being lost.
 as a result i belive the python venv will not be in the path and the privsep-helper which will be installed only with the venv will not be found. 

i think we need to set the helper_command option in the oslo privsep config section to 'sudo -EH privsep-helper' instead see

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep/blob/2e7308aa9b4cb45da3bc01f4c94aba663b06119d/oslo_privsep/priv_context.py#L51

i could be wrong though but thats my best guess for the logs."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-05 10:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-09 09:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-09 12:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

this seam to work well so +2 for more testing.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-01-15 05:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-01-15 21:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

++ muy bueno.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

> (2 comments)

So now with containers, we have two resources in pacemaker to manage containerized resources with a resource agent. e.g. for galera:
  . galera-bundle (the container itself)
  . galera (the resource agent that runs in the container)

In non-containerized scenario, the original resource can be called via their long name, which differ from the containerized scenario. e.g.:
  . galera-master (non-containerized)
  . galera-bundle (containerized)
  . rabbitmq-clone (non-containerized)
  . rabbitmq-bundle (containerized)
  . redis-master (non-containerized)
  . redis-bundle (containerized)
 
So if we only remove galera-master, and keep galera-bundle, maybe the upgrade would be simpler?

NB: resource which do not rely on resource agent like haproxy must be deleted all the time, because their name is kept unchanged between O and P.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 16:33:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - add pacemaker upgrade_tasks for Q upgrade

Early WIP to get the ball rolling. Not sure the trick with
"block: *rabbitmq_fetch_retag_container_tasks" will fly (worst
case we duplicate tasks :/).

Basically we need to handle both cases. Upgrade from baremetal so
we should kill the systemd things. Or upgrade from containers so
we should kill the container and retag the image.

Adding for rabbit as an example and for discussion and will iterate
here for the others.

Change-Id: Icacb31b79da3a18b7ab0986779a021dfe6a5553f

commit_message:
Add pacemaker upgrade_tasks for P..Q major upgrade

This adds pacemaker upgrade_tasks for Pike to Queens. We need
to handle both cases:
 - Upgrade from baremetal so we should kill the systemd things.
 - Upgrade from containers so we should kill the container pull
   and retag the image.

Change-Id: Icacb31b79da3a18b7ab0986779a021dfe6a5553f

messages:
[{'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:34:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

added Juan here so he can give input but looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17893, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

meh, lets just merge it as is.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:09:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FWIW upstream OpenSSH now defaults to No: https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-6.8

And AFAICT the only significant use of UseDNS is hostnames in authorized_keys (which we don't use) and hostnames in Match blocks (we use Match blocks for live migration over ssh, but we don't use hostnames there)"}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-02-19 07:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-02-19 07:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 13:32:29.000000000', 'message': 'Disable UseDNS in sshd config

The UseDNS causes the sshd server to perform a reverse DNS lookup when
a client connects which introduces reasonable delay when everything is
fine, but can be counted in seconds when DNS is not setup correctly.
This is particularly annoying when using ansible to configure the node
as it is failing with timeouts waiting for privilege escalation prompt.

This commit disables the UseDNS option since we do not use hostname
based authentication in TripleO.

Change-Id: Ib000f3488326a802d97d0bcdb3299d54248f0935
'}]
commit_message:
Disable UseDNS in sshd config

The UseDNS causes the sshd server to perform a reverse DNS lookup when
a client connects which introduces reasonable delay when everything is
fine, but can be counted in seconds when DNS is not setup correctly.
This is particularly annoying when using ansible to configure the node
as it is failing with timeouts waiting for privilege escalation prompt.

This commit disables the UseDNS option since we do not use hostname
based authentication in TripleO.

Change-Id: Ib000f3488326a802d97d0bcdb3299d54248f0935

commit_message:
Use keystone NoAuth plugin for auth_type none

We've been hacking this with the admin_token plugin, but we got a NoAuth
plugin added to keystoneauth. Use it instead.

Change-Id: Id1a861d54e3ba4d815e93d29ab9ca9f49debfd03

messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-31 20:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-01 12:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-15 21:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 20:52:06.000000000', 'message': "Add get_client_config method to CloudRegion

Client utilities sometimes need to be able to set some arbitrary
settings in their clouds.yaml file.

Add a get_client_config that takes an optional dictionary of defaults
and looks for a config section named for the client, falling back to
looking for a section named 'client'. (Thanks for the inspiration MySQL)

Change-Id: I9016746584d043f5b62170da6a52d4152885fe5b
"}, {'created': '2018-02-01 12:49:38.000000000', 'message': "Add get_client_config method to CloudRegion

Client utilities sometimes need to be able to set some arbitrary
settings in their clouds.yaml file.

Add a get_client_config that takes an optional dictionary of defaults
and looks for a config section named for the client, falling back to
looking for a section named 'client'. (Thanks for the inspiration MySQL)

Change-Id: I9016746584d043f5b62170da6a52d4152885fe5b
"}]
commit_message:
Add get_client_config method to CloudRegion

Client utilities sometimes need to be able to set some arbitrary
settings in their clouds.yaml file.

Add a get_client_config that takes an optional dictionary of defaults
and looks for a config section named for the client, falling back to
looking for a section named 'client'. (Thanks for the inspiration MySQL)

Change-Id: I9016746584d043f5b62170da6a52d4152885fe5b

commit_message:
Update the Tempest plugin to point towards the new plugin

The Magnum service has split it's tests for Tempest in a seperate
repo so this patch updates it.

This patch removes the linting issue for systemd daemon-reload
because the feature does not exist in the older Ansible release
used in stable/pike.

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: #1747607
Depends-On: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1
Change-Id: Ia4e323eda453ae3e8dacf3dcf14d175e00727b4f
(cherry picked from commit d484d3097e1f300eb7a25956e8816c0630121fe5)

commit_message:
Calculate name in CloudRegion

We calculate a name from the auth_url in the from_session factory
function, but it should really be a fundamental piece of logic for
CloudRegion about what to do with name not being present since we've
added in several paths for people to make a Connection that have nothing
to do with named clouds in clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Ib4cdcde6be50295e214e7cd4ca8c65b7da431529

commit_message:
Protect prepare_update_replace() with resource lock

When we consolidated resource locking with resource state transitions in
a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023, prepare_update_replace() moved
outside of the locked section, so that other update operations could
potentially conflict with it. This change ensures that we call it while the
lock is still held (if we have transitioned the resource to
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, and thus acquired the lock), or that we acquire the
lock before calling it (if UpdateReplace is raised before attempting to
update the resource).

To avoid unnecessary locking and unlocking, we only take the lock if the
Resource plugin has overridden the default handler method (either
restore_prev_rsrc() or prepare_for_replace()), since the defaults do
nothing.

 Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resource.py

This differs from the patch on master because
0e1b4908e55d6b1f11ec8cd190d719244194365c is not present in stable/pike,
so there are different paths for the cases where there are or are not
restricted actions in play.

Change-Id: Ie32836ed643e440143bde8b83aeb4d6159acd034
Closes-Bug: #1727127
(cherry picked from commit b0e18270b4af43452d6c2e229aa76db7ff120980)

it fixs'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 23:57:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types in convergence

When a user updates from a deprecated resource type to an
equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g. from
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup), Heat
is supposed to change the type without replacing the resource as it would
normally do when a resource type changes. This was broken in convergence,
because since 45073226752c58d640ea5a59b7e532c022a4939b the new Resource
object we create during the check_resource operation (using the new type's
plugin) is no longer automatically initialised with data from the database
as resources in the legacy path are.

Move the substitution checking to the Resource.load() method, so that it
now returns an instance of the new plugin where allowed. In the actual
update_convergence() method then we need only check that the resource class
is the one we'd expect from the new template, and replace the resource if
not.

We do have a test that is designed to check that this is working, but in it
we didn't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is potentially
getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other resource that
can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resource.py

This patch is modified with respect to the one on master, since the
branch does not contain 960f626c2455b77e654aea1d79597fadb91dc894. Thus,
resource_owning_stack.defn is substituted for initial_stk_defn and
curr_stack.defn for latest_stk_defn.

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
Closes-Bug: #1729439
(cherry picked from commit 93b4551d9a1ff9194b30a079f02db691129c69b0)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types in convergence

When a user updates from a deprecated resource type to an
equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g. from
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup), Heat
is supposed to change the type without replacing the resource as it would
normally do when a resource type changes. This was broken in convergence,
because since 45073226752c58d640ea5a59b7e532c022a4939b the new Resource
object we create during the check_resource operation (using the new type's
plugin) is no longer automatically initialised with data from the database
as resources in the legacy path are.

Move the substitution checking to the Resource.load() method, so that it
now returns an instance of the new plugin where allowed. In the actual
update_convergence() method then we need only check that the resource class
is the one we'd expect from the new template, and replace the resource if
not.

We do have a test that is designed to check that this is working, but in it
we didn't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is potentially
getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other resource that
can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resource.py

This patch is modified with respect to the one on master, since the
branch does not contain 960f626c2455b77e654aea1d79597fadb91dc894. Thus,
resource_owning_stack.defn is substituted for initial_stk_defn and
curr_stack.defn for latest_stk_defn.

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
Closes-Bug: #1729439
(cherry picked from commit 93b4551d9a1ff9194b30a079f02db691129c69b0)

commit_message:
libvirt: bandwidth param should be set in guest migrate

The bandwidth param set outside of the method "migrate" from guest
object have to be done inside that to avoid duplicating that option.

(cherry picked from commit c212ad27b0a18cf4caf3cf8edb27aaeab310d0e2)

Backported to avoid a minor merge conflict backporting change
I9b545ca8, and because it addresses a related issue calling
migrateToURI3.

(cherry picked from commit fa47da0923102dcbde3e5f2d6cb0965b0570346d)

nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py:
  Trivial conflict with change Id7ef609c, which fixed a typo in a
  comment.

Change-Id: I8a37753dea8eca7b26466f17dfbdc184c48c24c5
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:52:01.000000000', 'message': "Implement separate deploy and upgrade tests

The current functional test does a full upgrade process,
but uses the same current role for both the previous
version and the new version.

Ideally we want to test the initial deploy using the
previous series' role, so that we're actually testing
a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

This patch separates the upgrade test out and makes the
default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543245
Change-Id: I43e1e224cd4237ac37b40fde5ce7c279331a012d
(cherry picked from commit 1d399625d61b3fa0860dd28127aefe1fecc32634)
"}, {'created': '2018-02-19 13:25:49.000000000', 'message': "Implement separate deploy and upgrade tests

The current functional test does a full upgrade process,
but uses the same current role for both the previous
version and the new version.

Ideally we want to test the initial deploy using the
previous series' role, so that we're actually testing
a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

This patch separates the upgrade test out and makes the
default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543500
Change-Id: I43e1e224cd4237ac37b40fde5ce7c279331a012d
(cherry picked from commit 1d399625d61b3fa0860dd28127aefe1fecc32634)
"}]
commit_message:
Implement separate deploy and upgrade tests

The current functional test does a full upgrade process,
but uses the same current role for both the previous
version and the new version.

Ideally we want to test the initial deploy using the
previous series' role, so that we're actually testing
a series upgrade, not just a rabbitmq upgrade.

This patch separates the upgrade test out and makes the
default test just be a deployment. This allows us to
more clearly see where something breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/543500
Change-Id: I43e1e224cd4237ac37b40fde5ce7c279331a012d
(cherry picked from commit 1d399625d61b3fa0860dd28127aefe1fecc32634)

commit_message:
Add scenario tests for dhcpv6_stateful networks

Up to now there have been no tests for dhcpv6_stateful networks because
Cirros images were lacking a working DHCPv6 client. With the dependent
patch a new Cirros image will be used that has fixed this issue[1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cirros/+bug/1487041

Change-Id: I3deb04c8f0867162db0ed890b54d8166da140469
Depends-On: Ie37062bc11aaf379bca0a49b749759e0fa51b5e2
Depends-On: I6bd24a98d7c72a1bac28999eb3c9a831ab2ab9bf
Closes-Bug: 1509924

commit_message:
DNM: Test custom cirros image for Neutron tests

New image providing a couple of new features:

- DHCPv6 client
- ping with pmtud support
- modules for bonding and 8021q
- "ip neigh" command
- tcpdump command

Change-Id: Ie37062bc11aaf379bca0a49b749759e0fa51b5e2

commit_message:
Disable DVR in Neutron unless we configure it

The default value for enable_dvr is True, which doesn't work well
together with the default agent_mode=legacy. So disable DVR in that
case.

Change-Id: I0179d46f2414af2ca6b27accac708c59bb0f49b1
Related-Bug: 1731857

commit_message:
tests: Remove duplicated container creation

The meta-play test-setup-host.yml already includes
test-prepare-containers.yml so there's no need to
re-run it.

Change-Id: I91b63aeebc4afe67be160245eb8872c16c2da2ad
(cherry picked from commit f1ffba9e6f1b1da7262251d4a4bcd05935c0bd5f)

subject: Fix endif syntax for Download req task
messages:
[{'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you post the error you are seeing? According to http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/ "-" is used at the start or end of the block to be removed.'}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2017-11-14 18:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Can you post the error you are seeing? According to
 > http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/ "-" is used at the
 > start or end of the block to be removed.

There is no error itself, what I noticed is that the next task "Create OpenStack-Ansible requirement wheels" can't be executed causing disconnection of the computer.

Regarding the syntax, if the idea is that the block needs to be removed shouldn't the if sentence needs to start with "-" as well? like:

    {% if ... -%}
    {% endif -%}'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 19:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Can you post the error you are seeing? According to
 > > http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/ "-" is used at the
 > > start or end of the block to be removed.
 > 
 > There is no error itself, what I noticed is that the next task
 > "Create OpenStack-Ansible requirement wheels" can't be executed
 > causing disconnection of the computer.
 > 

But it seems to work fine

http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-10_03_56_34_307356

http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/openstack/container1/repo/repo_builder.log.txt.gz

(these logs are pretty recent)

How do you know that this task can't be executed?

 > Regarding the syntax, if the idea is that the block needs to be
 > removed shouldn't the if sentence needs to start with "-" as well?
 > like:
 > 
 > {% if ... -%}
 > {% endif -%}

I think the correct syntax would be

{% if ... -%}
{-% endif %}

but I don't think it matters much in this particular case.'}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > Can you post the error you are seeing? According to
 > > > http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/ "-" is used at the
 > > > start or end of the block to be removed.
 > >
 > > There is no error itself, what I noticed is that the next task
 > > "Create OpenStack-Ansible requirement wheels" can't be executed
 > > causing disconnection of the computer.
 > >
 > 
 > But it seems to work fine
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-10_03_56_34_307356
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/openstack/container1/repo/repo_builder.log.txt.gz
 > 
 > (these logs are pretty recent)
 > 
 > How do you know that this task can't be executed?
 > 
 > > Regarding the syntax, if the idea is that the block needs to be
 > > removed shouldn't the if sentence needs to start with "-" as
 > well?
 > > like:
 > >
 > > {% if ... -%}
 > > {% endif -%}
 > 
 > I think the correct syntax would be
 > 
 > {% if ... -%}
 > {-% endif %}
 > 
 > but I don't think it matters much in this particular case.

This is the output that I'm getting

    http://paste.openstack.org/show/626446/

I can try the other syntax that you mentioned above.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-16 09:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > > Can you post the error you are seeing? According to
 > > > > http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/ "-" is used at
 > the
 > > > > start or end of the block to be removed.
 > > >
 > > > There is no error itself, what I noticed is that the next task
 > > > "Create OpenStack-Ansible requirement wheels" can't be executed
 > > > causing disconnection of the computer.
 > > >
 > >
 > > But it seems to work fine
 > >
 > > http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-10_03_56_34_307356
 > >
 > > http://logs.openstack.org/63/518763/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-opensuse-423/c0b583b/openstack/container1/repo/repo_builder.log.txt.gz
 > >

 > > How do you know that this task can't be executed?
 > >
 > > > Regarding the syntax, if the idea is that the block needs to be
 > > > removed shouldn't the if sentence needs to start with "-" as
 > > well?
 > > > like:
 > > >
 > > > {% if ... -%}
 > > > {% endif -%}
 > >
 > > I think the correct syntax would be
 > >
 > > {% if ... -%}
 > > {-% endif %}
 > >
 > > but I don't think it matters much in this particular case.
 > 
 > This is the output that I'm getting
 > 
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/626446/
 > 
 > I can try the other syntax that you mentioned above.

Are you sure this is not an OPNFV/XCI problem instead of upstream OSA?

<aio1_repo_container-a7941b11> Task "Download requirement pip sources" has been omitted from the job because the conditional "["ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['repo_build']['need_wheel_build'] | bool", 'repo_build_store_pip_sources | bool']" was evaluated as "False"

So a conditional was evaluated to False. Why do you think there is a problem with the task itself or its syntax?

Nothing so far suggests that there is a problem with the upstream OSA code I think'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-16 10:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agreed with jesse.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-19 18:52:45.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This hasn't been touched in 3 months."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 17:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix endif syntax for Download req task

The "Download requirement pip sources" task of repo_build_wheels.yml
has wrong syntax in their endif instructions that causes next task
to scape its execution.

Change-Id: Iaa00a71a9131268fbdb6db2273f59405b77d2960
'}]
commit_message:
Fix endif syntax for Download req task

The "Download requirement pip sources" task of repo_build_wheels.yml
has wrong syntax in their endif instructions that causes next task
to scape its execution.

Change-Id: Iaa00a71a9131268fbdb6db2273f59405b77d2960

Switch to tripleomaster registry

The tripleoupstream registry is deprecated in favor of tripleomaster,
where images are pushed automatically on rdo promotion.

Change-Id: I88770c12513f8dde977a770a3555652e4ed4596d

commit_message:
Make the kuryr job not voting until it's fixed

The current kuryr job in the gate is not testing kuryr properly (in fact
it's not even installing it!).

This patch is making it non-voting until we can it sorted.

Change-Id: I2fab4fd5bd4ff58ad8ccd36d246aa862b1063cdc

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 49edbd39b14e648ce2fe2c5afa9e01adf684c80d'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 15:24:37.000000000', 'message': 'Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

This is a backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/527592
- https://review.openstack.org/545801

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
The option `lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or
enable the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Closes-Bug: #1745361
Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

This is a backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/527592
- https://review.openstack.org/545801

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
The option `lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or
enable the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Closes-Bug: #1745361
Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

i am conflicted on this.
+2 because i asked you to do this and it works on ubuntu
-1 because it does not work on centos

so +1 over all im good with merging if other are but after trying a number of different variation i dont know how to make this work for centos also.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-01-15 21:32:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@stephenfin: did you catch Sean's comment? any ideas?"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-17 22:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-17 22:40:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I spent a couple of hours at the weekend trying to figure this out. My best guess is that its either a delta between ubuntu's /etc/sudoers and centos's or it might be down to the python interperter.  I don't know if either are the issue but ill try adding python 35 functional test target to tox tomorrow. That would rule out an old python 27 interperter on the centos side."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-19 16:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Configure privsep binary

This is necessary because we're combining virtualenv's and sudo. sudo
doesn't passthrough environment variables by default, so we must do so
manually.

Change-Id: I8ef15edd1b8adae0ddad84f71379356ead5d4fd1
Related-bug: #1677238

commit_message:
Fix test_instance_get_all_by_host

This test was not testing instance_get_all_by_host,
it was testing _instance_get_all_uuids_by_host,
which is completely redundant with the same test
that comes right after it.

¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Change-Id: Ia0331e3f622f17067bf5900f92b3f8ff2aff966e
Closes-Bug: #1680614
(cherry picked from commit 1521049dae51220ac47aeed40ed80aa13ad57036)

commit_message:
Add 'delete_host' command in 'nova-manage cell_v2'

Add 'delete_host' command in 'nova-manage cell_v2'.
Add an optional 'force' option in 'nova-manage cell_v2 delete_cell'.
If specifying the 'force' option, a cell can be deleted
even if the cell has hosts.

The 'features' description is changed to the 'fixes'
in the release note.

Conflicts:
        doc/source/cli/nova-manage.rst

Change-Id: I8cd7826c2c03687c6b85731519778f09d542b236
Closes-Bug: #1721179
(cherry-picked from commit f4f17b364e28389f22bf9c6017dd7aef918c7104)
(cherry-picked from commit 868ef987625d6867dc0e315af6245776fa2da18a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 12:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Fix error handling and checks for generic volume groups

There are several issues with the implementation of generic volume
groups in the VMAX driver. There is no rollback implemented in case
of errors for create group from source or for deleting groups. There is
also no checking in place to determine if source groups have been
modified since a snapshot was taken, which can sometimes lead to issues.
Additionally, the provider_location is not being updated in the
individual volume snapshot objects of a group snapshot. This patch
rectifies these issues.

Change-Id: I3e6ac90b145015ccd820af3449b20e377c9f4651
Closes-bug: 1732488
'}, {'created': '2017-11-20 11:30:04.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Fix error handling and checks for generic volume groups

rectifies these issues.

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Fix error handling and checks for generic volume groups

There are several issues with the implementation of generic volume
groups in the VMAX driver. There is no rollback implemented in case
of errors for create group from source or for deleting groups. There
can be issues if source groups have been modified since a snapshot
was taken. The provider_location is also not being updated in the
individual volume snapshot objects of a group snapshot. This patch
rectifies these issues, and also does some general refactoring of
the generic volume group code.

Change-Id: I3e6ac90b145015ccd820af3449b20e377c9f4651
Closes-bug: 1732488

commit_message:
nova: only set default_floating_pool if using nova-net

The default_floating_pool option is deprecated since it is only
used in nova if you're running nova-network, so let's only set
it if n-net is running to avoid the deprecation warning in the
logs during jobs that are using neutron - which is nearly all
of them (except cells v1).

Change-Id: If1a6b2f0ffaaa25b7f34a6e9a6af066ef7eff077

commit_message:
Ensure that constraints are used for AIO bootstrap

Currently the pip_install role does not configure any
constraints when exercising the AIO bootstrap, creating
the possibility that the initial bootstrap may not have
the right software versions.

This patch ensures that the same constraints are used
for the AIO bootstrap as was done for the Ansible
bootstrap.

Change-Id: I6aa467d4f1f6db33c824f4fcf8e46adb0a26cfa0

commit_message:
Have zuul check out ansible for devel AIO job

Zuul is configured to understand ansible/ansible on github. Add ansible
as a required-project for the devel job so that depends-on patches will
work. Once we're happy with this, we can add the devel-aio job to be run
on PRs to os_ modules.

Change-Id: I12a74d97593c8780047d3dae9590f4e1fde3859b
