commit_message:
Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting

Currently the ARA database is not collected after each
test, nor is the reporting done as it should be. This
patch does the following to resolve that:

1. Informs the log collection to collect to and from
   the right source folder.

2. Verifies that the logs directory exists to ensure
   that a missing directory does not cause the job to
   fail.

3. Makes the log collection quiet, so that only errors
   are reported when pulling them back to the zuul
   executor.

4. Removes a layer of indirection by making zuul use
   the scripts library directly instead of working
   through yet another wrapper script.

5. Sets the exit code properly so that the ARA report
   is run on test execution failure.

Backport note:
This is a re-implementation of the patch done to
master as this branch does not have the cross-repo
functionality applied.

Change-Id: Ie8da165a33180d03c840a69dae0aa5f424a69e50

commit_message:
Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting

Currently the ARA database is not collected after each
test, nor is the reporting done as it should be. This
patch does the following to resolve that:

1. Informs the log collection to collect to and from
   the right source folder.

2. Verifies that the logs directory exists to ensure
   that a missing directory does not cause the job to
   fail.

3. Makes the log collection quiet, so that only errors
   are reported when pulling them back to the zuul
   executor.

4. Removes a layer of indirection by making zuul use
   the scripts library directly instead of working
   through yet another wrapper script.

5. Sets the exit code properly so that the ARA report
   is run on test execution failure.

Change-Id: Ie8da165a33180d03c840a69dae0aa5f424a69e50
(cherry picked from commit 9b86311836b0684dc76c0451dd83257792d5f118)

[{'created': '2018-02-14 23:18:01.000000000', 'message': "Simplify federation and oauth token callbacks

The token provider listened for specific callbacks from the
federation and oauth APIs. These were mainly for token invalidation
and token persistence removal. Now that the sql token driver and uuid
token provider have been removed, we can remove the need for
persistence notifications.

Instead, both of these cases can use a generic token cache
invalidation callback. This makes the token provider Manager simpler
because it only has to listen for a single internal notification to
invalidate the token cache, instead of multiple. It also makes the
code sending the notification easier to understand because it's
clearer about what it's doing.

Change-Id: I3281a013ce2764872dda8c183c4e9851974e1d14

commit_message:
Simplify federation and oauth token callbacks

The token provider listened for specific callbacks from the
federation and oauth APIs. These were mainly for token invalidation
and token persistence removal. Now that the sql token driver and uuid
token provider have been removed, we can remove the need for
persistence notifications.

Instead, both of these cases can use a generic token cache
invalidation callback. This makes the token provider Manager simpler
because it only has to listen for a single internal notification to
invalidate the token cache, instead of multiple. It also makes the
code sending the notification easier to understand because it's
clearer about what it's doing.

Change-Id: I3281a013ce2764872dda8c183c4e9851974e1d14

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 19:43:01.000000000', 'message': "Simplify INVALIDATE_USER_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE callback

This notification was traditionally used when keystone needed to
prune tokens from the backend when various things changed in the
system (e.g. user assignment changing, password changes, disabling
or enabling users, etc). Now that keystone doesn't support token
persistence, these are inaccurate and can be simplified.

Change-Id: I100b7416e8ba61eb4ea2c2eb4962e952a53ea388
"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 22:37:35.000000000', 'message': "Simplify token persistence callbacks

The INVALIDATE_USER_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE and
INVALIDATE_USER_PROJECT_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE callbacks were meant to
clean up invalid tokens from the token storage layer. Now that the
sql token driver has been removed, we don't need them any more. This
commit removes those notifications and refactors the places where
notifications are still needed, making them more specific and not
eluding to token persistence.

Change-Id: I100b7416e8ba61eb4ea2c2eb4962e952a53ea388
"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 22:49:37.000000000', 'message': "Simplify token persistence callbacks

The INVALIDATE_USER_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE and
INVALIDATE_USER_PROJECT_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE callbacks were meant to
clean up invalid tokens from the token storage layer. Now that the
sql token driver has been removed, we don't need them any more. This
commit removes those notifications and refactors the places where
notifications are still needed, making them more specific and not
eluding to token persistence.

Change-Id: I100b7416e8ba61eb4ea2c2eb4962e952a53ea388
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 20:41:27.000000000', 'message': "Simplify token persistence callbacks

commit_message:
Simplify token persistence callbacks

The INVALIDATE_USER_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE and
INVALIDATE_USER_PROJECT_TOKEN_PERSISTENCE callbacks were meant to
clean up invalid tokens from the token storage layer. Now that the
sql token driver has been removed, we don't need them any more. This
commit removes those notifications and refactors the places where
notifications are still needed, making them more specific and not
eluding to token persistence.

This commit also removes a significant amount of logic from the
assignment API that used to notify the token API when assignments
were deleted. This made sense when tokens were written to disk
because there was an opportunity to invalidate them when users were
removed from projects. This is no longer needed since we do
validation online and we don't persist tokens anymore.

Change-Id: I100b7416e8ba61eb4ea2c2eb4962e952a53ea388

[{'created': '2017-08-22 12:47:32.000000000', 'message': "Remove outdated service-to-driver mapping for backups

This mapping was introduced for backwaard compatibility in 2013 and
works only for Swift and Ceph. I don't think that somebody actually uses
such old way to configure backup service so if should be safe to remove
it without deprication.

Change-Id: Idf5aafae7a7e0c0bdcb857ec1f5c939671d8ae54

commit_message:
Remove deprecated service-to-driver mapping for backups

It was deprecated in Queens and now it's safe to remove this feature.

Change-Id: Idf5aafae7a7e0c0bdcb857ec1f5c939671d8ae54

commit_message:
Stop a connections leak when freeing an SSHPool

In SSHPool when we free the SSHpool add a destructor
that closes all the connections in the SSHPool.

In the SSHPool when we resize to make the max_size smaller
that current_size or otherwise end up with a
current_size being greater than the max_size, we now close
the connection by adding a put method that closes the
connection before discarding the connection.

Added UT

Change-Id: I655458e39676e18b2dd8efe9dbc66544b4260e61
Closes-bug: 1748558

subject: Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-19 15:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 15:24:51.000000000', 'message': 'Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

This is a backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/527592
- https://review.openstack.org/545801

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
The option `lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or
enable the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Closes-Bug: #1745361
Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Clean-up old systemd prep and allow machinctl to grow

This is a backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/527592
- https://review.openstack.org/545801

The machinectl cache is currently set image to 16G by default. If
multiple container images are imported into the cache this may be too
small by default. This change sets the cache to "64G" by default allowing
the cache more room to grow by.

This change also disables the quota system once the limit has been set
The option `lxc_host_machine_quota_disabled` has been added to disable or
enable the quota system as needed. This is done after the default limit has
been set so an adequately sized sparce file can be created should it not
already exist.

> More documentation can be seen here [0] with regard to the set-limit
  option.

Because we support both modern and older systemd, the cache prep tasks
for old systemd have been updated so that deployers using earlier
versions of systemd can benefit from the ability to grow an existing
cache via playbook run.

[0] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machinectl.html#set-limit%20%5BNAME%5D%20BYTES

Closes-Bug: #1745361
Change-Id: I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:19:10.000000000', 'message': 'Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)
'}, {'created': '2018-02-17 03:24:37.000000000', 'message': 'Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)

commit_message:
Correct variable used in SELinux context tasks

The correct name of the registered variable used to stat the neutron log
directory for SELinux contexts tasks is 'neutron_log_dir_check'.

Change-Id: I06fea11b1f6270be1aac3a89dbc061d4d5cd5690

subject: Stop running non-voting jobs in gate
messages: [{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:35:22.000000000', 'message': "Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Ic39e09e654a92f68c4441e739ec964bcb67431ad
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6e1c4cba27673960a24dec6fd0bcd4e4b2a0b365)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Ic39e09e654a92f68c4441e739ec964bcb67431ad
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6e1c4cba27673960a24dec6fd0bcd4e4b2a0b365)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I99fe9546b2fc0c07550443ef1ac7342272d90fae
(cherry picked from commit a692d06b81b596279b5550e1b328964ae3ca6010)

In Magnum Labels are stored in the form of dictionary. previously we

commit_message:
Now user can update label values in cluster-template

In Magnum Labels are stored in the form of dictionary. previously we
are passing string value directly to store the value of label. Now we
are parsing it and storing it in the form of dictionary.

Change-Id: I4d64da78dc4ed4d5599533b54861b65bce609c28
Closes-Bug: #1638863
(cherry picked from commit 21c87f35a0910963ac525dca829e98fe9f9a73f8)

commit_message:
Set correct group membership of /var/log/mysql_logs directory

This patch sets group membership to `adm`.
It makes Galera log files accessible for rsyslog daemon.

Change-Id: Id156037ad053b62036b5359f12eabbf54e7e1369
Closes-Bug: #1745442
(cherry picked from commit 96edcae4f5070edc99bd84b9136c4d7633288600)

subject: Join cluster without using a failed task
messages:
[{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Same as the master patch.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:14:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I think the skip_ansible_lints tasks could be improved by having a changed when and failed when, but it's good enough for a backport to queens."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:46:39.000000000', 'message': "Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923
(cherry picked from commit 83b398e18bf7eb5966e52e9f731eb2b5643f412a)

commit_message:
Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923
(cherry picked from commit 83b398e18bf7eb5966e52e9f731eb2b5643f412a)

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of command

This patch changes the use of systemctl via the command module
over to the Ansible systemd module.

One conditional check for systemd was removed since all supported
distributions deployed by OSA have systemd.

Change-Id: I926e94d185f4999e13b33f7d035b9dd5cf732f0b
(cherry picked from commit ad29910e6c68a5ba09ee087c821302cd0af0ab0d)

subject: Update installation mechanism
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nlgtm'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 15:15:53.000000000', 'message': 'Update installation mechanism

1. The current constraints generation for the installation
   involves multiple tasks and multiple variables.

   Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
   unnecessarily and the additional variables are
   unnecessary.

   This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
   hopes to speed it up a little.

2. Clean up developer mode logic

   Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
   1) developer_mode is not enabled
   2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

   Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
   logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
   which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
   cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
   can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
   venv usage) without enabling developer mode
   constraints.

Change-Id: I9daa4352aa818db03f682eb0d1a65eefff9bb6f6
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 15:21:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update installation mechanism

The following adjustments are made in order to modernise
bring the role into line with the other mainline roles:

1. Simplify the constraints mechanism.

2. Add the developer mode constraints functionality.

3. Clean up developer mode logic to allow pip installs
   into an existing venv if the deployer chooses to do so.

4. Normalise the distro package install task to make it
   use the same name, to add retries and ensure that the
   cache updates appropriately.

5. Clean up some commented vars and tasks which were not
   used.

6. Simplify the use of checksums for the venv downloads
   to use modern Ansible functionality.

7. Add additional python venv prep for SuSE/CentOS.

8. Add the recording of the current venv tag deployed.

Change-Id: I9daa4352aa818db03f682eb0d1a65eefff9bb6f6
'}]
commit_message:
Update installation mechanism

The following adjustments are made in order to modernise
bring the role into line with the other mainline roles:

1. Simplify the constraints mechanism.

2. Add the developer mode constraints functionality.

3. Clean up developer mode logic to allow pip installs
   into an existing venv if the deployer chooses to do so.

4. Normalise the distro package install task to make it
   use the same name, to add retries and ensure that the
   cache updates appropriately.

5. Clean up some commented vars and tasks which were not
   used.

6. Simplify the use of checksums for the venv downloads
   to use modern Ansible functionality.

7. Add additional python venv prep for SuSE/CentOS.

8. Add the recording of the current venv tag deployed.

Change-Id: I9daa4352aa818db03f682eb0d1a65eefff9bb6f6

[{'created': '2018-02-15 17:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Allow sqalchemy filtering by id and uuid

These additions will allow us to filter nodes
by node uuid and id. This filter API is used
in many places throughout the code base. It is
natural to expect that this API would allow us to
filter by node id and uuid in addtion to the other
supported parameters. This also fixes a 3 year old bug.

This change from lucasagomes has a bug:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197141/

In conductor/manager.py, he calls _fail_if_in_state()
and uses the node_id as a filter. However this filter
effectively does nothing because sqalchemy does not
know how to filter by node id on the backend. My changes
fix this problem and make the API more intuitive

commit_message:
Allow sqalchemy filtering by id and uuid

These additions will allow us to filter nodes
by node uuid and id. This filter API is used
in many places throughout the code base. It is
natural to expect that this API would allow us to
filter by node id and uuid in addtion to the other
supported parameters. This also fixes a 3 year old bug.

This change from lucasagomes has a bug:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197141/

In conductor/manager.py, he calls _fail_if_in_state()
and uses the node_id as a filter. However this filter
effectively does nothing because sqalchemy does not
know how to filter by node id on the backend. My changes
fix this problem and make the API more intuitive

Closes-Bug: #1749755

Change-Id: I4efc0d5cd5d5d6108a334f954e1718203b47da0a

commit_message:
Add option to install the Octavia client

Allow installation of the Octavia client in the Undercloud by setting
new option enable_octavia=True in the undercloud.conf. Default is not to
enable.

Change-Id: I2b27dac2f30a126e6519d19cc135ea6eea59e8a9

subject: Check sha1sum of hosts file instead of md5sum
messages: [{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-02-17 05:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-18 11:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 05:14:05.000000000', 'message': "Check sha1sum of hosts file instead of md5sum

In Ansible 2.5, the stat module moves calculating md5 checksums of files
to the 'checksum_algorithm' option and 'checksum' return value.
To retain compatibility with both current and new versions of Ansible,
use the default checksum algorithm, sha1, instead.

Change-Id: I6e606193f66a4f4c6c70eceee8eeaef05a099f26
"}]
commit_message:
Check sha1sum of hosts file instead of md5sum

In Ansible 2.5, the stat module moves calculating md5 checksums of files
to the 'checksum_algorithm' option and 'checksum' return value.
To retain compatibility with both current and new versions of Ansible,
use the default checksum algorithm, sha1, instead.

Change-Id: I6e606193f66a4f4c6c70eceee8eeaef05a099f26

[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:45:03.000000000', 'message': 'Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa

(cherry picked from commit 0f18e40fb61086b89cf12932cf9583adaf5b5609)

commit_message:
Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so
that we're confirming pip can be locked down prior to setting the
pip.conf file which can, and will break a deployment if configured
incorrectly. These tasks will only fire when the option
`pip_lock_to_internal_repo` has been set to "true" making them a no-op
by default.

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa
Depends-On: Icc2ee264fc213b258642b5393dd78b1b26ef0542
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f18e40fb61086b89cf12932cf9583adaf5b5609)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 11:21:10.000000000', 'message': "Maintain backwards compatibility for the machinectl volume size

In I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115 the format for
lxc_host_machine_volume_size was changed from a forced GB
value to a value where the size can be specified by the user.

Unfortunately this totally breaks previous settings, as
demonstrated by the need to implement this patch to get the
integrated build to work again:
https://review.openstack.org/544724

Unfortunately this means that any value set in any previous
series will also fail, meaning that an upgrade from a previous
setting in a previous or same series will fail.

This is not an acceptable outcome, so this patch forces it
back to using Gigabytes as documented and makes sure it's
consistent across the old/new systemd implementations. It also
converts any other values set (perhaps with trailing G/K) to
use G so that regardles sof someone setting it in the interim
state it will still work.

Change-Id: Iee220190b92613707f890929aad855dec46892da
"}, {'created': '2018-02-19 12:31:53.000000000', 'message': "Maintain backwards compatibility for the machinectl volume size

This is not an acceptable outcome, so this patch forces it
back to using Gigabytes as documented and makes sure it's
consistent across the old/new systemd implementations. It also
converts any other values set (perhaps with trailing G/K) to
use G so that regardles sof someone setting it in the interim
state it will still work.

Change-Id: Iee220190b92613707f890929aad855dec46892da
"}]
commit_message:
Maintain backwards compatibility for the machinectl volume size

In I85fefc6ce186bb6808ac37a9ea79a50e29671115 the format for
lxc_host_machine_volume_size was changed from a forced GB
value to a value where the size can be specified by the user.

Unfortunately this totally breaks previous settings, as
demonstrated by the need to implement this patch to get the
integrated build to work again:
https://review.openstack.org/544724

Unfortunately this means that any value set in any previous
series will also fail, meaning that an upgrade from a previous
setting in a previous or same series will fail.

This is not an acceptable outcome, so this patch forces it
back to using Gigabytes as documented and makes sure it's
consistent across the old/new systemd implementations. It also
converts any other values set (perhaps with trailing G/K) to
use G so that regardles sof someone setting it in the interim
state it will still work.

Change-Id: Iee220190b92613707f890929aad855dec46892da

[{'created': '2018-02-19 10:45:59.000000000', 'message': "Clear the cached machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique, at present our cached ID is
being stored which is then being cloned upon container create. This
change simply removes the machine-id files from the cache so that we're
not re-using ID's throughout the cloud.

More information on the systemd machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ie20e3f01bf818f7c5510d6bffd19abdce8b38180

commit_message:
Clear the cached machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique, at present our cached ID is
being stored which is then being cloned upon container create. This
change simply removes the machine-id files from the cache so that we're
not re-using ID's throughout the cloud.

More information on the systemd machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ie20e3f01bf818f7c5510d6bffd19abdce8b38180
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/545316
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit b9183eb59f256b1bc26d9915c64add7e3c4f2226)

commit_message:
Add docs for application credentials

Add documentation in the User section on managing, using, and rotating
application credentials.

Since application credential support didn't make it into
python-openstackclient in the Queens release, show examples using
python-keystoneclient.

Change-Id: I24bc51d2f3741771ba321fc05d49fd111aa76c15
(cherry picked from commit 25996a8534b1a8d46fd838a188f1005dc53346b1)

We need a tempest test case for it as well. I am surprised tempest doesn't have coverage in this area. :-)"}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-10 22:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 72307f288274f8403347c6e029bddded6d284d22'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-10-13 19:40:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I might be able to add tests for the migration tests ? (since the
 > FK is only added there)
 > 
 > Or do we want to add the FK in the model too? (would be good)

We consistently add FK to models elsewhere in keystone. I don't see why we can't do that here too. The bug report has a description of everything done to recreate those, which should all be doable via the API (and a test)."}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-18 18:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-18 18:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-18 18:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-10-18 18:55:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

-1 is for the test needing to be explicit. This should not merge until you're sure the FK is re-added.

Check with NON-SQLite to verify that adding the FK again wont break anything."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-10-19 20:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-20 12:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-20 14:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-20 14:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2017-10-20 20:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-10-20 23:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2017-10-23 15:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27246, 'date': '2017-11-21 06:17:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This patch is not universal.
It is also logically unlogical to delete a user's domain before deleting it."}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-22 06:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-22 08:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-22 16:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-22 16:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-22 17:45:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-23 07:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-24 12:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

The "keystone.exception.UnexpectedError: An unexpected error prevented the server from fulfilling your request." errors are because this change is adding a foreign key from the user table to the project table but these tests do not always populate the project table because up until now they do not have to, so trying an insert into the user table causes a DBReference error. If we go forward with this change all of these tests will have to be updated to first create a default domain before creating a user.

The mysql problems with dropping the foreign key in the test are because the foreign key was created with no name, sqlalchemy tries to autoname it and fails to find a constraint with the name it made up.

The sqlite problems with asserting the foreign key is gone is because sqlite can understand the create syntax for a foreign key but otherwise completely ignores everything to do with foreign keys. So it succeeds in the "drop" because it ignored it, but then still sees it present when it inspects the create syntax. The postgresql problem I'm not sure about, it might be similar to the mysql problem where it's trying to drop a constraint with a name it doesn't know.

It would be good if we could find a way to solve this without adding the foreign key at all. I'm not sure yet why a notification at the manager layer of the identity module isn't sufficient.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-24 13:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

Could you add a unit test? It should go in keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_backends.py and should look something like this: http://paste.openstack.org/show/653381/

Unfortunately with the way the backend unit tests are run on sqlite and with how the notification in keystone/identity/core.py is supposed to work, that test won't really be able to show the broken behavior but it would still be good to have."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Actually - Samuel was working on tempest tests for this, which would be able to accurately demonstrate the bug and the fix, could you make sure those are in good shape? https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610/ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947'}, {'account_id': 27668, 'date': '2018-01-26 08:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

tempest test review passed zuul: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947 The CI build failures don't seem related to the code change."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-29 16:16:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

I'm fine with this, the only thing is I'd like to see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610 working first, but given the gate issues right now I want to hold off on rechecking it."}, {'account_id': 23140, 'date': '2018-01-29 23:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-01-30 22:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: -Code-Review

Morgan is right, this won't work if the identity backend is LDAP. I proposed a possible alternative that fixes the existing notification instead of trying to delete identity objects from the resource manager: https://review.openstack.org/539347"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I think this can be abandoned, given that we merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539347/ to close the bug. Thanks for doing the legwork on it :)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:57:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2017-09-21 19:34:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: try to reproduce bug 1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d
'}, {'created': '2017-09-21 21:40:33.000000000', 'message': 'Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d
'}, {'created': '2017-10-18 18:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Delete users before deleting domains

In the migration process [1], we added a FK for user.domain_id
to domain.id. Users would only be deleted after the domain
delete, when the notification was propagated, however this
would make the FK to break.

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

It also adds the FK to the model and add another migration
to make sure all deployments have the FK present, including new
deployments launched between when 014 was merged and now
(which did not have the FK in the model neither had run 014).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

commit_message:
Delete users before deleting domains

This patch fixes the behavior by deleting domain users
before deleting the domain itself.

Closes-Bug: #1718747

Change-Id: Iba615826356bd4efcf9fb83c7b239ce9a856102d

I found the issue in the RDO CI.

commit_message:
Make cluster-config rbac compatible for kubebernetes

The user admin needs to have system:master in the organization
and needs to be named admin.

Closes-Bug: #1689849
Change-Id: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
(cherry picked from commit 2d5efb2e4da8bfae03a9e550dfa325115cc4cd3b)

subject: Fix Glance db_sync issue
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:10:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks. I haven't tested the fix, but hopefully it does what we want to. Otherwise we'll go with an exec."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-16 19:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2018-02-16 20:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

How is this working for Keystone db sync, Glance LP https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1749640 links to the Keystone docs https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/doc/source/admin/identity-upgrading.rst#upgrading-without-downtime
where it says Keystone creates triggers since Newton?'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-02-17 18:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck

probably worth seeing how this works after other blockers were fixed'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-17 19:50:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm doing this: https://review.openstack.org/545623"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-18 14:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> How is this working for Keystone db sync, Glance LP
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1749640 links to the
 > Keystone docs https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/doc/source/admin/identity-upgrading.rst#upgrading-without-downtime
 > where it says Keystone creates triggers since Newton?

In keystone(and neutron) running "expand", "migrate", "contrast" is optional, while glance dy_sync(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/) runs all three implicitly that's should be the reason issue is not faced in keystone yet(we might not be calling --expand while deploying or upgrading). So looks like glance should do the same.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

So this workaround will be ugly, no matter what we do:
- either we set the paramaters using "SET GLOBAL..."
- or we configure it in my.cnf directly, requiring 1/2 additional mysql server restarts

I like the idea Emilien proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545623/

I'm also asking some Glance devs to look into this issue again'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So this workaround will be ugly, no matter what we do:
 > - either we set the paramaters using "SET GLOBAL..."
 > - or we configure it in my.cnf directly, requiring 1/2 additional
 > mysql server restarts
 > 
 > I like the idea Emilien proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545623/
 > 
 > I'm also asking some Glance devs to look into this issue again

Hi Christian,

Please have a look https://review.openstack.org/544792, I have proposed a change to do not execute triggers in case of offline migration. Hopefully this will solve your problem.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There is a possible fix for Glance itself: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544792/'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> There is a possible fix for Glance itself: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544792/

I tried this patch in tripleo fs017 and it worked for me.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-02-19 13:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this one in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544792/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 09:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Glance db_sync issue

A recently merged change [1] requires that either the SUPER privilege is
set for the Glance DB user or the option log_bin_trust_function_creators
variable is set. The latter one looks safer, thus setting it before the
Glance db_sync is executed and revoking it afterwards.

commit_message:
Fix Glance db_sync issue

A recently merged change [1] requires that either the SUPER privilege is
set for the Glance DB user or the option log_bin_trust_function_creators
variable is set. The latter one looks safer, thus setting it before the
Glance db_sync is executed and revoking it afterwards.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Closes-Bug: 1749641
Change-Id: I4ba353a9a91769bcd08cc39a307b29c4d01daf18

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I3fc0e1597785ee101f362c028744da466a141ded
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6460f6731e7819365e3ab671f8ad929b395c1652)

commit_message:
VMAX driver - revert a volume to last snapshot

VMAX Support for reverting a volume to last snapshot.

Change-Id: I1a4b5c000d1b2fc50ed89f9ad874e9e6c62f0290
Implements: blueprint vmax-revert-volume-to-snapshot

commit_message:
docs: Add booting from an encrypted volume

Now that the instructions for booting from a volume
have been migrated to nova, the instructions for
booting from an encrypted volume can be added as
well.

This commit adds instructions for how to import an
image into an encrypted volume.

Closes-Bug: 1701614

Change-Id: Ida4cf70a7e53fd37ceeadb5629e3221072219689

commit_message:
Install yum utilities in openstack_hosts

Every CentOS host will need various yum utilities at some point, so
let's install it within openstack_hosts to save time later.

commit_message:
Allow deployers to configure yum fastestmirror

This patch uses the new ``openstack_hosts_enable_yum_fastestmirror``
variable to determine whether yum's fastestmirror plugin should be
enabled.

messages: [{'account_id': 748, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nrecheck branched requirements'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:34:34.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I151195de5e2a01788619387d434d5d2d5b50e2e7
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I151195de5e2a01788619387d434d5d2d5b50e2e7

This adds a new script that uses guestfish to build a whole-disk
image and partitions that requested on command line.

commit_message:
Import script to convert overcloud-full to a whole-disk image

This adds a new script that uses guestfish to build a whole-disk
image and partitions that requested on command line.

Example usage (to be documented in tripleo-docs):

    $ tripleo-build-wholedisk-image --partition /:8192 \
        --partition swap:1024 --partition /var:8192

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I157d52d4f08190b0626a7e7e9e9e5d2a5a474bce

subject: Fix some typos
messages:
[{'account_id': 27640, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:44:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

The tests are trivially different than the patch on master, only because
ce120bfda848e55ba06b606681e7c1b8ae3de923 is not present in Pike.

commit_message:
Include outputs in rolling update of ResourceGroup

The template generated by ResourceGroup should include outputs that
reference any needed resource attributes. However, previously it only did
so when rolling updates were not enabled by an update_policy.

The tests are trivially different than the patch on master, only because
ce120bfda848e55ba06b606681e7c1b8ae3de923 is not present in Pike.

Change-Id: Ice7a92fe8d2b14e2470d9089a8e191c8385994f1
Closes-Bug: #1741981
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 7a046e6ffd8daaa21202eeb691d12f2dbf9abfc1)

commit_message:
Fix resource.<n> attribute caching in ResourceGroup/Chain

When generating the nested template output, we need to take into account
both forms of syntax:

   get_attr: [<group_name>, resource.<index>.<attr_name>, ...]

or

   get_attr: [<group_name>, resource.<index>, <attr_name>, ...]

Previously we would generate an output for the former case but not the
latter, so the attribute wouldn't get cached when that syntax was used.

Change-Id: I2a059d5cc42d794ca71caaa1661c32eb76c733fc
Closes-Bug: #1742185
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 77112137bb368304be2437de09f0224e8e38ab58)

subject: Fix attribute caching in Heat AutoScalingGroup
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-31 20:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 20:06:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix attribute caching in Heat AutoScalingGroup

Attributes for an individual resource in an OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup can
be retrieved using the attribute name 'resource.<index>'. Because we were
treating the index as a resource name when generating the template, we
would never generate an output in the nested template that referenced the
resource's attribute, so it wouldn't get cached. Since we can't know the
indices ahead of time, the only way to cache these is to do it for all
resources in the group - which is the same data cached by the equivalent
'outputs' attribute.

We also need to take into account both possible forms of syntax:

    [<asg_name>, resource.<index>.<attr_name>, ...]

or:

    [<asg_name>, resource.<index>, <attr_name>, ...]

Change-Id: I1d2898cdd4759b1bb9de1896a40056685e728f44
Closes-Bug: #1737047
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 4a3a1ad15bdcfd67e0548481c70545e41a9476d9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix attribute caching in Heat AutoScalingGroup

Attributes for an individual resource in an OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup can
be retrieved using the attribute name 'resource.<index>'. Because we were
treating the index as a resource name when generating the template, we
would never generate an output in the nested template that referenced the
resource's attribute, so it wouldn't get cached. Since we can't know the
indices ahead of time, the only way to cache these is to do it for all
resources in the group - which is the same data cached by the equivalent
'outputs' attribute.

We also need to take into account both possible forms of syntax:

    [<asg_name>, resource.<index>.<attr_name>, ...]

or:

    [<asg_name>, resource.<index>, <attr_name>, ...]

Change-Id: I1d2898cdd4759b1bb9de1896a40056685e728f44
Closes-Bug: #1737047
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 4a3a1ad15bdcfd67e0548481c70545e41a9476d9)

messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-31 20:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-31 22:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

When the parent template references the 'deploy_stdouts', 'deploy_stderrs',
or 'deploy_status_codes' (all plural) attributes of
SoftwareDeploymentGroup, ensure that outputs are generated that reference
the corresponding 'deploy_stdout', 'deploy_stderr', or 'deploy_status_code'
(all singular) attributes of the child template's SoftwareDeployment
resources.

Change-Id: Iff7101dbaa57602be68e3c7447971dacdd747880
Closes-Bug: #1741552
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 3ec13d9a8fe1ccf03913ed0a02c720312c13332b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix attribute caching in SoftwareDeploymentGroup

When the parent template references the 'deploy_stdouts', 'deploy_stderrs',
or 'deploy_status_codes' (all plural) attributes of
SoftwareDeploymentGroup, ensure that outputs are generated that reference
the corresponding 'deploy_stdout', 'deploy_stderr', or 'deploy_status_code'
(all singular) attributes of the child template's SoftwareDeployment
resources.

Change-Id: Iff7101dbaa57602be68e3c7447971dacdd747880
Closes-Bug: #1741552
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Related-Bug: #1660831
(cherry picked from commit 3ec13d9a8fe1ccf03913ed0a02c720312c13332b)

commit_message:
Update YAQL queries with groupBy

YAQL introduced a backward incompatible change in one of its minor
versions:
https://github.com/openstack/yaql/commit/3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025#diff-f36776b660e5fe4f88e3295e5b751396R215

It changes the expected behavior of groupBy() aggregator, so we need to
update our queries otherwise it fails with a "list index out of range"
error.

Change-Id: I2ca2ebb2c8d22aeedbcb6920072db5b6dba3311b
Closes-Bug: #1750032
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. [{'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-17 21:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2017-12-05 23:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

a few minor comments.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Before I go any further, please rebase this change.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-24 21:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-24 21:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10379, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-02-02 01:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

(9 comments)

A couple of things ...

1. I believe list_idrac_settings() needs an idrac_fqdd parameter, just like set_idrac_settings(), to support systems that provide one (1) IP interface for managing multiple iDRACs, such as the FX2 and M1000. Otherwise, when by_name is True, key collisions will occur during the construction of the returned dictionary.
2. It seems that there should be more negative tests of set_idrac_settings(). Please consider the tests of set_bios_settings() in dracclient.tests.test_bios.ClientBIOSConfigurationTestCase.'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-02-07 21:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I mistakenly assigned this a -2. A -1 should have been used, instead.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-02-07 23:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(9 comments)

In regards to #2, there is no need for iDRAC card settings unit tests that handle error conditions as the error conditions are already thoroughly handled by the BIOS settings tests.  If you run the unit tests and look at the code coverage, you will find that set_settings is fully covered.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10379, 'date': '2018-02-13 20:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-02-14 01:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Thank you for considering my comments.

More negative tests of set_idrac_settings() would detect missing or errant validate() methods in the iDRACCardEnumerableAttribute and iDRACCardIntegerAttribute classes, similar to the missing validate() method this change corrected in iDRACCardStringAttribute. Those cannot be found by the negative BIOS settings tests. They could be added down the road, in a separate change.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:19:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree that adding test cases that increase the test coverage for retrieving iDRAC card attributes does not belong in this patch.'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hrm ... In my first reply, I suggested the addition of more test cases for setting iDRAC card attributes, not retrieving them.

"2. It seems that there should be more negative tests of set_idrac_settings(). Please consider the tests of set_bios_settings() in dracclient.tests.test_bios.ClientBIOSConfigurationTestCase."

The validate() methods in the iDRACCardEnumerableAttribute and iDRACCardIntegerAttribute classes that I discussed in my prior reply are exercised when iDRAC properties are set.

I am fine with adding those tests in a separate patch.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The validate methods were added a long time ago in the code for retrieving iDRAC card attributes.  This patch is not about adding additional test cases that were missed being added at that time.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-19 11:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Refactor list_bios_settings and set_bios_settings

This patch factors the code in list_bios_settings and set_bios_settings
out into utility methods that can be used by other code that has the
same functionality.

Change-Id: I310fc0cb1c8372b1391d085078686e616890eb6f

[{'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-16 14:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-16 21:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-19 16:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Rather than bother with deprecations, why not just leave commit_required and reboot_required? This does not look too bad.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:05:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Well, the current return value of commit_required indicates if reboot is required.  If I were to change it to what it should be, then the return value would change to an indication of if a config job should be created, which isn't the same thing.  The only way we can be sure this would work is if we can be sure that whenever the iDRAC returns RebootRequired=True it also returns CreateConfigJob=True, and I'm not sure that this will always be the case."}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(18 comments)

There are a couple of issues related to the RAID changes that need to be resolved.

1. The returned dictionary does not include the new is_commit_required key, even though a reboot is required. For clarity and consistency, it seems to me that the returned dictionary should always include it.
2. Presently, dracclient.client.DRACClient.commit_pending_raid_changes() does not offer support for taking advantage of an 'Optional' is_reboot_required value. That would be real time configuration. Real time configuration is described by the "Real Time Storage Configuration Using PERC9 on Dell 13th Generation PowerEdge Servers" white paper (http://en.community.dell.com/techcenter/extras/m/white_papers/20441007). Until it does, when its value is 'Optional', the only choice is to reboot, so it is required. That is confusing to me. Note that I am not suggesting that real time support be included in this change.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(17 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-01-20 00:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-22 14:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-22 14:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-01-22 19:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

My comments about dracclient/client.py apply to dracclient/resources/raid.py, too.'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2018-01-22 21:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 22:19:43.000000000', 'message': 'Separate reboot required from commit required

This patch separates indicators for reboot required and commit required.  It
does this by adding two new parameters (is_reboot_required and
is_commit_required) to the dictionary returned by set/create/modify operations
while continuing to return the commit_required key for backwards compatibility.

The commit_required key should be considered deprecated at this time and it
will be removed in a future patch.

The is_reboot_required key can have three possible values: True, False, and
"optional".  This allows the return of optional for RAID operations that can
return this value.

Change-Id: I70e52868f10bfafb30bbb38b85888bc4ec8e65ae
Closes-Bug: 1732549

commit_message:
Separate reboot required from commit required

This patch separates indicators for reboot required and commit required.
It does this by adding two new keys (is_reboot_required and
is_commit_required) to the dictionary returned by set/create/modify
operations while continuing to return the commit_required key for
backwards compatibility.

The commit_required key should be considered deprecated at this time and
it will be removed in a future patch.

The is_reboot_required key has an enumerated value that can have three
possible values: true, optional, and false.  This allows the return of
optional for RAID operations that can return this value.

Change-Id: I70e52868f10bfafb30bbb38b85888bc4ec8e65ae
Closes-Bug: 1732549

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 11:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Rework exception handling on deploy failures in conductor

Currently on unexpected python error we only log the error message, e.g.
"NoneType object is not iterable" or just KeyError missing key. This is
obviously not helping debugging too much.

This change splits error handling into separate handling of IronicException
and other exceptions.

For IronicException: only log the error message, remove redundant "Error: "
from the last_error message.

For other exceptions: log traceback, mention that the exception was not
expected.

Finally, move logging to the top of the error handling helper to make sure
it never gets lost.

Change-Id: Idc2339c3bdad8092907d9651d40f241a2ae50dbe
Related-Bug: #1741223
(cherry picked from commit 2b5849b49e24f310b7cf7f7c2e9a8b14f11da2a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Rework exception handling on deploy failures in conductor

Currently on unexpected python error we only log the error message, e.g.
"NoneType object is not iterable" or just KeyError missing key. This is
obviously not helping debugging too much.

This change splits error handling into separate handling of IronicException
and other exceptions.

For IronicException: only log the error message, remove redundant "Error: "
from the last_error message.

For other exceptions: log traceback, mention that the exception was not
expected.

Finally, move logging to the top of the error handling helper to make sure
it never gets lost.

Change-Id: Idc2339c3bdad8092907d9651d40f241a2ae50dbe
Related-Bug: #1741223
(cherry picked from commit 2b5849b49e24f310b7cf7f7c2e9a8b14f11da2a7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 10:13:21.000000000', 'message': 'Rework exception handling on deploy failures in conductor

Currently on unexpected python error we only log the error message, e.g.
"NoneType object is not iterable" or just KeyError missing key. This is
obviously not helping debugging too much.

This change splits error handling into separate handling of IronicException
and other exceptions.

For IronicException: only log the error message, remove redundant "Error: "
from the last_error message.

For other exceptions: log traceback, mention that the exception was not
expected.

Finally, move logging to the top of the error handling helper to make sure
it never gets lost.

Change-Id: Idc2339c3bdad8092907d9651d40f241a2ae50dbe
Related-Bug: #1741223
'}]
commit_message:
Rework exception handling on deploy failures in conductor

Currently on unexpected python error we only log the error message, e.g.
"NoneType object is not iterable" or just KeyError missing key. This is
obviously not helping debugging too much.

This change splits error handling into separate handling of IronicException
and other exceptions.

For IronicException: only log the error message, remove redundant "Error: "
from the last_error message.

For other exceptions: log traceback, mention that the exception was not
expected.

Finally, move logging to the top of the error handling helper to make sure
it never gets lost.

Change-Id: Idc2339c3bdad8092907d9651d40f241a2ae50dbe
Related-Bug: #1741223

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-23 06:46:33.000000000', 'message': "Another proposal of Automated Tiering's hidden account name rule

In patch #448525, there will be one hidden acount per account which
has tiered container. The following table is example.

+-------------------------+------------------------------------------------+
| original (user defined) |  derivative (automatically created by daemons) |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
|    acc    |     con     |      acc       |      con       | policy index |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered_acc1  |    1_con1      |      1       |
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered_acc1  |    2_con1      |      2       |
|   acc1    |    con2     |  .tiered_acc1  |    2_con2      |      2       |
|   acc2    |    con3     |  .tiered_acc2  |    1_con3      |      1       |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+

In this case, tiering daemons need to make derivative containers
list, in '.tiering_info' account, because tiering daemon need to GET
derivative containers to know timestamps of objects in derivative
containers.

There is a counterproposal of hidden derivative account names and
contaienr names. In the counterproposal, one hidden account will
be used, and original account name and original container name
will be included in derivative container name. The following table
is example.

+-------------------------+------------------------------------------------+
| original (user defined) |  derivative (automatically created by daemons) |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
|    acc    |     con     |    acc     |        con         | policy index |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered   | quote(acc1/con1/1) |      1       |
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered   | quote(acc1/con1/2) |      2       |
|   acc1    |    con2     |  .tiered   | quote(acc2/con2/2) |      2       |
|   acc2    |    con3     |  .tiered   | quote(acc3/con3/1) |      1       |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
Note: quote is function of swift.common.utils.quote

In this case, tiering daemons don't need to make derivative container
list, because result of GET '.tiered' account is derivative containers
list.

There is Pros and Cons in each proposal.
Proposal of patch #448525:
    Pros: If each original account don't have many containers,
          counts of each derivative account's containers will not be
          large.
    Cons: Tiering daemons should make derivative containers list.

Counterproposal:
    Pros: Derivative containers list is not required.
    Cons: Count of '.tiered' account's containers can be large,
          because all derivative containers in Swift is stored in
          the '.tiered' account.

This patch is implementation example of the counterproposal for discussion.

Change-Id: I7f0cad2737c138a3f50fff13ab3b679f1e318b84

commit_message:
Another proposal of Automated Tiering's hidden account name rule

In patch #448525, there will be one hidden acount per account which
has tiered container. The following table is example.

+-------------------------+------------------------------------------------+
| original (user defined) |  derivative (automatically created by daemons) |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
|    acc    |     con     |      acc       |      con       | policy index |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered_acc1  |    1_con1      |      1       |
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered_acc1  |    2_con1      |      2       |
|   acc1    |    con2     |  .tiered_acc1  |    2_con2      |      2       |
|   acc2    |    con3     |  .tiered_acc2  |    1_con3      |      1       |
+-----------+-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+

In this case, tiering daemons need to make derivative containers
list, in '.tiering_info' account, because tiering daemon need to GET
derivative containers to know timestamps of objects in derivative
containers.

There is a counterproposal of hidden derivative account names and
contaienr names. In the counterproposal, one hidden account will
be used, and original account name and original container name
will be included in derivative container name. The following table
is example.

+-------------------------+------------------------------------------------+
| original (user defined) |  derivative (automatically created by daemons) |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
|    acc    |     con     |    acc     |        con         | policy index |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered   | quote(acc1/con1/1) |      1       |
|   acc1    |    con1     |  .tiered   | quote(acc1/con1/2) |      2       |
|   acc1    |    con2     |  .tiered   | quote(acc1/con2/2) |      2       |
|   acc2    |    con3     |  .tiered   | quote(acc2/con3/1) |      1       |
+-----------+-------------+------------+--------------------+--------------+
Note: quote is function of swift.common.utils.quote

In this case, tiering daemons don't need to make derivative container
list, because result of GET '.tiered' account is derivative containers
list.

There is Pros and Cons in each proposal.
Proposal of patch #448525:
    Pros: If each original account don't have many containers,
          counts of each derivative account's containers will not be
          large.
    Cons: Tiering daemons should make derivative containers list.

Counterproposal:
    Pros: Derivative containers list is not required.
    Cons: Count of '.tiered' account's containers can be large,
          because all derivative containers in Swift is stored in
          the '.tiered' account.

This patch is implementation example of the counterproposal for discussion.

Change-Id: I7f0cad2737c138a3f50fff13ab3b679f1e318b84

Need to investigate why'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-17 19:30:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

All the gates are in the process of being migrated to ZuulV3 native jobs. see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544959/ and rebase your patch onto it. See https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kuryr-kubernetes/+spec/zuulv3-native-gates.

I won't be accepting patches on the gates that aren't tied to that one, as otherwise it'd imply redoing a lot of work.

See Rocky PTG agenda for details at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kuryr-ptg-rocky"}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-02-17 20:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-02-17 20:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add Dragonflow gate

This commit adds a tempest gate for kuryr with Dragonflow as a neutron
backend. It only tests a configuration with cni daemon and
containerized options enabled.

Partial-Implements: blueprint enhance-upstream-gates
Change-Id: Ie5faa560668109662a3adf7cbcc5d7aa1eecd6e4

Change include: to include_tasks:

This removes warnings in Ansible 2.4+.

longer used by Ansible.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary lazy-loaded queries

This patch removes lazy-load queries to speed up database
operations when using neutron-lbaas.

Change-Id: I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb
Closes-Bug: #1706466

commit_message:
Clear the cached machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique, at present our cached ID is
being stored which is then being cloned upon container create. This
change simply removes the machine-id files from the cache so that we're
not re-using ID's throughout the cloud.

More information on the systemd machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ie20e3f01bf818f7c5510d6bffd19abdce8b38180
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544375
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
heat_docker: Require docker instead of docker-py

docker-py was renamed to docker. Use docker with the version mentioned
in global-requirements.
Also docker.Client was renamed to docker.APIClient (see [1]).

[1]
https://docker-py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/change-log.html#breaking-changes

Change-Id: I041727c1817c55be5265cc77d6ab9b5db5bf5dcf

2018-02-06 21:08:09.146330 | centos-7 | TASK [galera_server : Install galera_server role remote packages] **************
2018-02-06 21:08:09.167538 | centos-7 | Tuesday 06 February 2018  21:08:09 +0000 (0:00:03.090)       0:16:31.002 ******
2018-02-06 21:08:10.381658 | centos-7 | fatal: [infra1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "http://yum.mariadb.org/10.1/centos/7/x86_64/repodata/repomd.xml: [Errno 14] HTTP Error 404 - Not Found\nTrying other mirror.\nTo address this issue please refer to the below wiki article \n\nhttps://wiki.centos.org/yum-errors\n\nIf above article doesn't help to resolve this issue please use https://bugs.centos.org/.\n\n\n\n One of the configured repositories failed (MariaDB Repo),\n and yum doesn't have enough cached data to continue. At this point the only\n safe thing yum can do is fail. There are a few ways to work \"fix\" this:\n\n     1. Contact the upstream for the repository and get them to fix the problem.\n\n     2. Reconfigure the baseurl/etc. for the repository, to point to a working\n        upstream. This is most often useful if you are using a newer\n        distribution release than is supported by the repository (and the\n        packages for the previous distribution release still work).\n\n     3. Run the command with the repository temporarily disabled\n            yum --disablerepo=MariaDB ...\n\n     4. Disable the repository permanently, so yum won't use it by default. Yum\n        will then just ignore the repository until you permanently enable it\n        again or use --enablerepo for temporary usage:\n\n            yum-config-manager --disable MariaDB\n        or\n            subscription-manager repos --disable=MariaDB\n\n     5. Configure the failing repository to be skipped, if it is unavailable.\n        Note that yum will try to contact the repo. when it runs most commands,\n        so will have to try and fail each time (and thus. yum will be be much\n        slower). If it is a very temporary problem though, this is often a nice\n        compromise:\n\n            yum-config-manager --save --setopt=MariaDB.skip_if_unavailable=true\n\nfailure: repodata/repomd.xml from MariaDB: [Errno 256] No more mirrors to try.\nhttp://yum.mariadb.org/10.1/centos/7/x86_64/repodata/repomd.xml: [Errno 14] HTTP Error 404 - Not Found\n", "rc": 1, "results": []}

commit_message:
add ml2 config for networking bgpvpn

- provides an option to choose ODL BGVPN
- installs networking-bgpvpn driver
- configures neutron to use ODL BGPVPN driver
- add bgpvpn scenario as a non-voting zuul job
- run networking-bgpvpn tempest

Change-Id: I29b3da7d29399708b2edef2328b174434d081259
Signed-off-by: Periyasamy Palanisamy <periyasamy.palanisamy@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
Restructure charm to follow src dir format

The OpenStack reactive charms use a src directory to store the
'source' charm. Convert the vault charm to comply with this
structure.

Change-Id: I7dd36b9aa7419459238f989dfe6c0553f7641cdf

commit_message:
Change include: to include_tasks:

This removes warnings in Ansible 2.4+.

The patch also removes the "static:" argument which is no longer
used by Ansible.

Change-Id: Iee7cd23ccd93e0f3a379fcd42dbd12ba3ee25cac

commit_message:
Use the last name of a file path of deployment-files parameter.

IR uses basename of deployment-files path as a base for
 environment files. Use same mechanism here when looking for
 docker-images.yaml file.

Change-Id: I135ed98b45616e4daa49a68393818c1f2458c6d9
(cherry picked from commit fa31a8f7a5dac8af030773b5a9a1d9514ccb7e73)

commit_message:
Add .gitreview

Add .gitreview file to point at openStack gerrit

Bring tox.ini and requirements mostly inline with other
reactive charms. tox.ini has to deviate slightly as
charm currently has no src dir.

commit_message:
Make cluster-config rbac compatible for kubebernetes

The user admin needs to have system:master in the organization
and needs to be named admin.

Closes-Bug: #1689849
Change-Id: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab

messages: [{'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-01-31 13:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 13:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Add openstack_ca_file configuration option

In the drivers section of magnum.conf add openstack_ca_file.
This file is expected to be a CA Certificate OR CA bundle
which will be passed on every node and it will be installed
on the host's CA bundle.

Update devstack plugin to use the ssl bundle if tls-proxy is
enabled.

Install the CA for drivers:
k8s_coreos_v1
k8s_fedora_atomic_v1
k8s_fedora_ironic_v1
mesos_ubuntu_v1
swarm_fedora_atomic_v1
swarm_fedora_atomic_v2

Add doc in troubleshooting-guide.

Add release notes.

Closes-Bug: #1580704
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-agent
(cherry-picked from 65dfb2009feb298d131a52e10c29c36c0eb668bd)
Change-Id: Id48fbea187da667a5e7334694c3ec17c8e2504db
"}]
commit_message:
Add openstack_ca_file configuration option

In the drivers section of magnum.conf add openstack_ca_file.
This file is expected to be a CA Certificate OR CA bundle
which will be passed on every node and it will be installed
on the host's CA bundle.

Update devstack plugin to use the ssl bundle if tls-proxy is
enabled.

Install the CA for drivers:
k8s_coreos_v1
k8s_fedora_atomic_v1
k8s_fedora_ironic_v1
mesos_ubuntu_v1
swarm_fedora_atomic_v1
swarm_fedora_atomic_v2

Add doc in troubleshooting-guide.

Add release notes.

Closes-Bug: #1580704
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-agent
(cherry-picked from 65dfb2009feb298d131a52e10c29c36c0eb668bd)
Change-Id: Id48fbea187da667a5e7334694c3ec17c8e2504db
